text: 2013 A: Pitch black with a thin light brown lacing N: Chocolate, coffee (still!), bourbon, vanilla T: Vanilla, bourbon, coffee, chocolate O: Wow... Really impressed that the coffee is still so present! Really nice one!
Chocolate, Bourbon, Roasted Coffee, Light cherries. Didnt like this as much as some of the other BCBS variants. Cheers!

From mobile phone notes: bottle 0.355l, Release 2014 with 12.6% abv. in City beer SF in the end of january 2017 (only 14$!): pours black oily, opaque with creamy tiny brown head which transforms itself to a ring around the glass. Aroma: roasted grain, intense chocolate, coffee, cacao, vanilla, coffee nibs, bourbon. Flavour follows aroma in intensity. Coffee flavour somehow faded out, but still all ingrediends are perfectly blended. Finish is dry, slightly astringent due roasted grain and coffee, body is thick, carbonation is smooth, carbonation is low.

Vintage 2014. Un immense merci à Marc-André pour le partage de cette sublime bière. Aucune mousse, filme huileux de surface. Robe noire, opaque mais étonnamment pas lourde du tout. Le liquide valse plutôt légèrement dans mon verre. En y plongeant mon grand nez propulsé par lexcitation, je reçois au visage une chaude attaque de café africain, léger comme tout et comme sil avait été infusé la veille. Le café est encore aussi riche et structuré après tout ce temps? Cest prodigieux! Je respire encore recherchant la base de cette bière que jai dû visiter au moins 50 fois dans ma vie et je ne la trouve nulle-part. Voyons donc! Allez, on ouvre la Stout 2014 pour les comparer côte-à-côte! Cest une autre bière. La structure nest pas la même. Cest autre chose totalement. La café est dune douceur et dune souplesse alors que le stout est liquoreux et riche. Du côté du café, je ne sens aucunement lalcool. La structure du café est à ce point complexe que le reste nest que faire-valoir à sa splendeur. Des notes de bourbon très délicates, un léger caramel blond. Très étrange cette impression que cette déclinaison de la Bourbon County à de plus grandes affinités avec la Barley Wine quavec la Stout. On ouvrira tout de même pas une Barley Wine pour comparer tout de même. Restons raisonnables et contentons-nous dadmirer ce chef doeuvre qui nétait peut-être pas meilleur frais. Du très grand art!

16. Bottled. Pours black not much of a head. The 
A late is thick and creamy. The taste is bourbon county sweetness with a big coffee bite. Awesome variant and I feel is better than the base BC. Awesome job
Decadent though slightly acidic and stringent on the finish. Rich, smooth oily body. Toasty mocha finish.

This beer is not for amateurs. Thick and viscous, heavy on the coffee and deep in flavor, your taste buds will either succumb to its massive flavors with delight or be so overpowered you will cringe at even hearing the name "coffee stout" in the future!

Side by side vertical of 2015 & 2016
500ml bottle @ Craig Bay. 2016 Vintage
Pours a black with almost no head. Nose is rich with ample coffee, bourbon, vanilla, and molasses throughout. Flavour is also rich and yummy. That sweet bourbon fudgy goodness with a nice coffee kick with hints of vanilla and molasses. Very enjoyable brew!

500ml bottle @ Craig Bay. 2015 Vintage
Pours black with a very active brown head. Nose is sour, coffee, bourbon, and chocolate. Sadly this bottle was of the infected bottles. My last bottle of this one was not. There is clearly a sourness and active carbonation that should not be present. This resulted in a drain pour as the mix of it all did not mesh well. I understand certain bottles were infected. Too bad I hit a 50/50 infection vs not.
Nice addition to the original. Aromas and flavors of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt. Thick and black. Heavy and smooth.

Pours black with almost no head. Aromas of chocolate, muscovado sugar, roasted coffee, roasted nuts, muscovado sugar, oak. Taste is chocolatey with pronounced coffee notes abd light vanilla with oak character. Mouthfeel is somewhat oily with medium body and low carbonation.

Pours black with low brown head 
Aromas of coffee, bourbon, dark chocolate, dark fruits, dried fruits 
Taste has notes of bourbon, vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate, dades, raisins, dried fruits 
Mouthfeel is creamy, warming, sweet , wee bit sticky with average carbonation, medium bitterness

33cl bottle at home - 2013 vintage. Very dark brown pour with a thin and fizzy tan head that disappears quite quickly. Notes of bourbon, burnt caramel, brewed coffee and just a hint of roasted coffee beans, plus toffee. Quite sweet up-front, but a roasty coffee layer follows right after. Smooth texture, low carbonation. It reminds me of KBS in some ways, just more bourbon-forward. I need to try this fresh - it feels a bit thin and the coffee faded. A world class beer, anyway.

Keg Half Pint at White Horse American Beer Festival 2015, Parsons Green, London in July 2015 - Opaque Black in colour. Medium Brown head. No lacing. Aroma of coffee and vanilla. Very Malty; lots of espresso coffee, dark chocolate, roasty malts, vanilla, caramel, more coffee, hint of bourbon. Thick, dense and rich. Hoppy. Sweet coffee and chocolate roasty malty throughout. Wow!! Enjoyed this a lot. Terrific coffee Impy Stout! (2015-07-02)

Poured from a growler from Growler Guys East in Bend. Pours a beautiful inky black with a thin beige head. Nose is loaded with bourbon as well as toffee, vanilla, and caramel. Not a lot of coffee but a hint. Taste is a perfect combination of bourbon and dark roasty malts. Buttery toffee, vanilla, chocolate come through too. Again not too much coffee which is perfect for me. Thick oily texture you would expect from an imperial stout. This is a delicious beer.

Bottled 10/29/14. Pours pitch black, tan head. Aroma is lots of bourbon, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, coffee. Coffee clearly faded a lot. Molasses on the back end. Flavor is roasted, earthy, coffee beans, bourbon, vanilla, caramel, chocolate, nice coffee bitterness finish. Coffee faded a lot but its there more than OG BCBS. Good. As good as any BCBS variant Ive had.
Poured a dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of roast malt, a little coffee and dark chocolate, dark alcohol soaked fruit. Full body, flavour as the aroma. Could have been a bit more coffee-ish.

2016 BCS w/Intelligentsia Flecha Roja coffee. Dark roast coffee aroma with a bit of lactose sweetness and some base-beer BCS characteristics showing through. Very dark brown color with no head. Tastes much smoother than it smells. Creamy and slightly sweet turns into sharp roast, with an aftertaste that is slightly boozy. Silky smooth palate, extremely well done overall. This is the best rendition of coffee BCS that I have had.

2013. Black of color with a brown head. An aroma of green pepper, liqurice, sweets, prunes, coffee, weak spiced and alcohol. Notes of swim hall. An oily texture with coffee, liqurice, prunes and a alcohol burn in the finish.
Old rating, transferred to RB. Bottle. Dark color, strong notes of coffee and chocolate. Taste of coffee, bourbon and chocolate

Taps deep coffee sable with a chocolate brown head. Aroma delivers charred malt, quality coffee, dark chocolate and toasted hop character. Bold flavor unleashes chocolate, quality coffee, bourbon, roasted malt, smoky and woody tones for a truly delicious brewski. Mouthfeel features viscous body and good fizz. Watch out, this one will hit you like a MARTA bus hauling ass down Georgia 400!

Dark chocolate colored. Opaque. Minimal tan head. 
Sugar, maple syrup, vanilla, toffee, butterscotch, and coffee aromas. 
Sweet and malty throughout. 
Strong chocolate, coffee, and toffee flavors. 
Great special occasion or dessert beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are large coffee, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, and very thick.
2014 bottle Dark brown color. Light fringes on the edges light coffee nose. Cocoa nibs. Medium mouthfeel. Oak barrel. Boozy finish.

12 ounces bottle from trade with Jason 6 months ago. Bottle date: 07 Nov 14. Aroma: really similar bourbon aroma than in the regular bcbs. So, intense bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, light coffee but probably faded away with time. I guess its better that then drinking an infected 2015 bottle. And anyway I love it. App: pitch black, minimal brown head, no retention. Taste and palate: full body, silky, a tad liquoreux, light to medium sweetness, lots of bourbon in mouth, subtle coffee, subtle bitter and alcohol burning finish. Overall: perfect palate. Drinks lovely. Not bitter or just a tiny bit. Love the mouthfeel including this subtle burning finish. Regarding the aroma, first time having this beer so no clue if this is supposed to be more coffee forward. Should have drank it as soon as I got it from this trade, maybe it was already too late. Anyway, no need to have more coffee to find this incredibly good. I really hope next year wont be infected as I will sure try to get my hands on many. Perfect beer!

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 Infected bottle: 17/SEP/15 1351. Pours a crackling cola head (uh oh) into a snifter. Head quickly recedes to hug rim. Sour chocolate and espresso aromas. Dark soy, molasses and sour hot overripe plums upfront turning to espresso in the lasting finish. I wanted to try and rate like it was from Jolly Pumpkin, but only bumped it up slightly, but ultimately a drain pour.

UPDATE - I sent a note to Goose Island letting them know about a potential quality control issue (I was unaware of the infection issue) - heres there response: 

"Thank you contacting Goose Island Beer Company. Were sorry but the deadline for 2015 Bourbon County Coffee and Barleywine refunds was Monday, February 29, 2016 as previously shared on the January 8, 2016 announcement. Were sorry for any disappointment this may have caused you and hope that you respect our decision. Thanks for being a Goose Island fan."

Given that, I am no longer a fan...
As expected this bottle is infected: 17/sep/15 1840. Sour in nose and mouth, still some hints of coffee and chocolate. Sad, but Im sure my next try will be a good one.

Bottle. Tasted blind. Thanks, Mike. Nose of alcohol fumes, scorched coffee, whiskey barrel, and vanilla. Dark translucent brown, slick. Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, dark fruit, with a smooth sweet hot finish. Medium-heavy body. Pleasant, but the coffee is a bit too ashy and rough.
It is still better than 90% of the stouts, but I much prefer the original BCBS. Roasted coffee flavor kills the beauty of the original BCBS. Thats just me saying.
Fantastic. Tastes (and smells!) very strongly of bourbon barrel & alcohol. If I *had* to complain about anything, it would be that it seems just a hair overcarbonated for my preferences.

2014 vintage. Full Coffee Aroma, Plenty of coffee, little oakiness, vanilla, light burnt Sugar and red fruits. Very complex aroma, full of coffees sourness, impressive. Pour black with Mocha head, first Sip was a sweet iced coffee followed by sweet vanilla, some chocolate, but a very sweet oakiness hint. Vanilla is gentle and sweet, the beer was creamy, full boadied, plaesant on the palate little sticky. Umbelievable.

Deep cloudy, brown. Vanilla, some bitterness, more sweetness. Medium body, good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smell is amazing...sweet caramel smell with the perfect alcohol amount and a hint of leather...wow...can you guys make a candle?! Taste is so smooth, even for high alcohol....cant barely taste it...sweet but not too much...complex taste...some oak perhaps...diverse and changing...slightest burn of alcohol on finish...wonderful

2013 bottle. This was pretty much the richest thing Ive ever had -- the Bourbon County sweetness, chocolate, and roast are all there, and the coffee is still pronounced, even after 2 years. Its silly how tasty this beer is.

Tap @ Beer Temple, at Goose Island Migration week, with Markoijelena and Zlotta (a.o.). 2014 edition. Black color. Dense brown head with reasonable retention. Aromas: coffee, dark chocolate, roasted, sweet, vanilla, some red fruit. Retronasal there more (ground) coffee, mocha, sweet, vanilla, light red fruit. Flavor is moderate to full sweet, roasted. Strong alcohol feel (but not overly so). Rather full bodied. Long finish. Became soooo much better after warming up....

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2016 Sampled from tap at Beertemple, 2014 version, 14.5% abv. Pitch black with a thin, tan head. Roasty-malty aroma with lots of coffee, dark chocolate and some hazelnut. Sweetish-malty, moderately roasty taste of milk coffee, dark chocolate, hazelnut and vanilla, followed by a long, roasty-bitter, warming and slightly alcoholic finish. Full body, thick and oily mouthfeel, flat. Balance is good, lots of coffee though but in a pleasant way, less boozy than the regular one.

Draft 0.15l at The Beer Temple Amsterdam Netherlands.Version 2014.Taste with Zlotta.19.03.2016.Pour it dark color with thick small white head.Aroma smooth dark chocolate,some coffee beans but moslty chocolate amazing aroma,Taste perfectly balanced of bourbon barrels,leather,roasted coffee,dark chocolate,bittery like chocolate finish.After taste coffee really nice smooth texture and balanced.Maybe even better than try regular in Pozarevac last time we will see now for 2015 regular Bourbon county.

(Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Coffee) Bottle 355 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 13.4%. Vintage 2013
Pitch black colour on the body, small and thin brown head on top, average to low retention.
Aroma of roasted malts, alcohol, nice coffee notes, chocolate.
Taste of roasted malts, not as much coffee as the aroma suggested, alcohol, vanilla.
Thick body, nicely carbonated.
Very good.

Bottle from Healthy Spirits SF, bought in February 2015. 

Black with no head. Sweet with coffee, hazelnuts, dark chocolate and some hints of bourbon. Nicely balanced and with a long finish. A tasty one.
@ Eddan 16-2-6: Doften stor och tydlig av hasselnöt. Smaken är söt med tydlig nougat. Riktigt gott.

Tasting at Hackneys Printers Row. Aroma is of cracked coffee beans and some dried fruit. Lighter bodied than some of the other BCS variants. Boozy, oaky, coffee, smoky, outstanding. Dryer finish than some of the variants as well.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2016 At home, another bottle from Maakun. I feel 0.1 more enthusiastic! 

Tasting thuis, fles van Maakun! Thanks dude! Daar staat-ie dan! Hallemeloeja lekkere koffieboterkoek! Lekkere zachte olievette brei met hele fijne notige koffiesmaakjes. Marsepein en pecannotenbrood en appelstroop. Backlog from 2015/11/05.

2015 version on tap at FS FW post-Nutcracker. Amazing. Heavy on the coffee, which is why I love it. Aroma is of dates, prunes, nuts, and coffee. ABV (13.4%) is quite masked by the coffee and mouthfeel is very balanced, yet crazy smooth. Reminds me of the Amavida coffee (from St. Andrews) that they serve at church each Sunday. Outstanding, especially on this cold, rainy night. Makes me a bit peckish for more.
12oz bottle of 2014. Pours a dark brown color without any head. Low carbonation. Coffee is strong and over powers a little.

2012 vintage, cellared for 3 years. Huge bourbon and coffee on the nose with a hint of vanilla. Big coffee taste with vanilla and bourbon and some smokiness. Time has really mellowed the sweetness! World class beer, one of the best Ive ever had.

2014 vintage, 12.6% abv. Aged in my basement for one year. Pours jet black, with very little tan head. Aroma is amazing: rich dark coffee, malts, and dark fruits. Taste is amazing: complex, lots of coffee on top of an excellent bourbon barrel aged imperial stout. The alcohol kick is there in the background. This is one of the best beers I have ever tasted. Thumbs WAY up!

Enjoyed on tap in a Goose Island glass December 5, 2015. 

Look - Oily brown black. Thick tan head. Little to no lacing.

Smell - Sweet molasses. Banana split. Coffee is not overpowering. Chocolate. Raisin. Tootsie roll.

Taste - I like that the coffee is not overpowering. Sweet. Chocolate. Bourbon. Raisins.

Feel - Very smooth. Little carbonation. High abv is hidden well.

Overall - Banana split stout. Rum barrel aged beers taste like bananas foster and this tastes like banana split.

2015 bottling:  Huge coffee aroma, molasses, brown sugar, crispy sweet toffee, vanilla, & cocoa on the nose; bitter & milk chocolate, with nice charred aromatic wood on taste; smooth, full body on palate, with drying finish. Excellent!

Pours pitch black into a snifter with a brown head that fades quickly into a thin ring round the glass.

Aroma of strong bourbon like the normal stout, but the intensity is cut with a hint of coffee. 

Flavors bourbon, vanilla, licorice and coffee are present. Coffee is there but very subtle. Bourbon is still the star in this one. I like how the coffee makes the bourbon a bit milder, because its almost too overpowering in the normal BCBS. Boozy elements start to appear as the beer warms, but also coffee starts to be a bit more present. Super tasty.

Such a great mouthfeel for an imperial stout. Chewy and mouthcoating. Nothing like it.

A great beer and one Ive been trying to find for a while. Finally got it

Coffee lovers rejoice. Aroma of freshly brewed strong black coffee. Little to no tan head. Taste is coffee with a hint of alcohol.Sits great on palate with the coffee taste lingering well after the beer is swallowed. Doesnt even taste like a 12.4% beer. Cant wait till next black Friday to see how the coffee stout tastes again. Brewed and stored in Chicago Illinois.

2015 Bottle--solid black pour with small-medium beige head. Not much coffee in the aroma, but lots of bourbon. Taste is roast without coffee bitterness with a lot of alcohol. The alcohol tones down as the beer warms. Gift. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft to taster at FoBAB 2015 pour opaque black with thin tan head. Nose coffee, bourbon, cassis, roasted malt. Taste similar, roast and coffee. Had this late in the night so Im sure it would rate higher in isolation.

Bourbon county stout is already my favorite beer. With the coffee it puts it over the top. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2015 from draft: Full and rich flavors of mocha bean, chocolate and marshmallow. Subtle black plum notes throughout the ultra-creamy mouthfeel, but this is dominated by coffee flavors, finishing with a note of peppery spice that adds intrigue. Finish lingers long.

2015 bottle. Menacing black pour with a frothy dark brown head. Standard bonkers BCBS aroma with tons of roast, sweet fruit, vanilla, cream, wood, bourbon, spent coffee grounds. Flavors were mega roasty and followed suit from the aroma. Lots of vanilla, coffee, bourbon, sweet cream, super balanced and smooth to the max. Slick and oily mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. This stuff is so delicate yet extreme at the same time. Its wild. The coffee is there but isnt in the forefront, just playing in the background. World class.

2013 bottle opened November, 2015. Pours out opaque black with a small red/brown head that quickly diminishes Rich aromas of wooden barrel (obvs), black coffee, chocolate, and alcohol. The coffee still comes through pretty strongly for something with two years of age to it. The flavors open up with chocolate, dried fruits, and powerful barrel and wood. Thick and creamy mouthfeel with fairly strong carbonation is pleasant and softens a very powerful beer.

2015 on draft at Rare Day 2015. Compared it to 2014. 2015 is better (obviously - its fresher) so Ive rated that. Everything about this is coffee. Its aroma is like sticking your head inside a bag of coffee beans. Flavor is well roasted coffee witha nice balance of bourbon stout still able to be tasted. This is the bomb.

Bottle shared, 2014 version. Pitch black with short lasting dark beige head that leaves an oily film. Lots of bourbon up front, sweet fresh coffee beans, dark chocolate, cocoa beans, vanilla, molasses, roasted nuts, licorice, lots of toffee, sweet black berries, burnt toast, marzipan and flowery honey. Over medium sweet with long lasting coffee bitter finish. Full bodied with almost chewy but still slick, oily feel with low carbonation. Massive stuff, very nice and complex.

Bottle at Black night 10/2015. Really really intense coffee both in aroma and flavour. Even too much for my liking, but the beer is still f-in great. Very rich and complex taste - aside from intense coffee there is lots of caramel, dried and red fruits, chocolate, roasted. Warming mouthfeel. Excellent, could be even better with less coffee - but that is just me.

Bottle at Black night,. Vintage 2013. Almost black color with small white head. Strong coffee aroma with roasted malt, milk chocolate. Taste, chocolate, coffee beans, nuts, caramel, bourbon, wood, alcohol. Tasty.

Bottle shared by Cuso, many thanks. Batch 2013. Pours black color, beige foamy head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, alcohol. Taste of strong coffee, chocolate, nuts, very sweet, bourbon, sherry, vanilla. Nice bittersweet chocolate finish.
[2014] 355ml bottle. Pitch black with a thin foamy tan head. Flavors are roasted cereals, bourbon, coffee, vanilla, caramel and alcohol with fruity notes. Full body, soft carbonation, slick texture.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2016 As Bourbon County Brand Coffee Stout, 2014 edition, with 12.6% ABV. Deep mocha beige, crackling head, breaking in instants and leaving a thin beige rim on the edge of the glass with some sparse lacing, but completely vanishing in the end; colour is a very dark mahogany brown, near black, but still transparent (and hazy) on the edges. Strong and complex aroma of coffee liqueur, melting milk chocolate bars, bitter chocolate sauce, dry oak, vanilla tannins, high quality bourbon, brown game stock, soy sauce, marmelade, cappuccino, old madera, gingerbread, pear syrup, black pepper, black tea. Candied sweetness in the mouth, candied dates and marmelade, rounded and a bit sticky but with soy sauce-like umami accents and soft, deep, friendly sourishness for balance, refinedly and gently tingling carbonation, thick and oily but still remarkably supple mouthfeel and therefore remarkably high drinkability; multi-layered, deep caramelly, nutty and chocolatey maltiness, bittersweet and providing a lot of body. Complex finish of big chocolatey and bitterly roasted malts, which blend in smoothly with the added coffee; the latter gives an extra, tangy spiciness to the whole without becoming obtrusive - in fact, the coffee does not seem to simply lay on top of the dark malts as is often the case in coffee stouts, it is actually built in, in a very clever way; warming, peppery alcohol sensations are present but only in the very end and never becoming astringent; and a dry, tannin-rich woodiness along with some deep, structural, spicy hops provide enough drought to balance the initial candied sweetness, the way it ought to be. In fact, this drying ending is very much the same as in the other BCBS beers and I still believe this is what makes them so great. Other big, complex and expensive hyped stouts are often a bit too cloying, only a minor flaw in comparison with their great complexity, but this series does not even show this small imperfection. This coffee edition in particular stands at the same gastronomic height as its regular counterpart; both are obviously very close to each other, but this one has a subtle touch of coffee to add to the already baffling complexity of the regular BCBS, yet it also seems a bit sweeter. The first counterbalances the last.  A thing of utmost beauty, but unfortunately I have to take a second tasting into account, of a younger bottle which showed signs of this much-debated infection; though still highly enjoyable, it did not match the splendour of that first bottle and therefore painfully downgrades my score here.

2014 vintage draft at Strangelove in late September 2015. Opaque black/brown pour with an impressive dark brown head. Lasting ring. No lace. Silky dark coffee. Strong dark malt flavors. Chocolate souffle. Charcoal grill. Black vinyl. Coffee grounds. Has some slightly harsh acetic notes and a bit of tang (not sure if this is due to its age or not) - still works. Vanilla bean. Liquorice. Marmite. Plums and prunes. Black cherries. Black currants. Molasses. Shoe polish. Vinyl. Complex goodness.

Tijdens bierproeverij, uitgeschonken in Struise BD degusteer glaasje. Dit was een van de bieren waar ik erg naar uitkeek. Zwart bier, met die perfecte olieachtige structuur die een goede Imperial Stout heeft. Het aroma is heerlijk en zoet, met de juiste kenmerken die een Imperial Stout moet hebben. Met tonen van: gebrande mout, karamel, aromatische koffie, zachte bourbon en wat gedroogd fruit als vijgen en dadels. Heerlijk bier met een zoet smaakpallet en en licht droge geroosterde afdronk. Met smaaktonen van karamel, bruine suiker, bourbon whisky, en een verfijnde koffie smaak. De alcohol is verbazend goed verborgen, wat ook iets zegt over de fantastische kwaliteit van deze Amerikaanse Imperial Stout. 
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Coffee 2013
Bottle from Rich shared with some appreciative stout fiends in Osaka. Thanks Rich! Great coffee nose with light bourbon notes. The taste is fantastic coffee, soft bourbon that caresses the palate. This was superbly balanced and drank like a dream. Top knotch.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2015 Black, beige head. Aroma of coffee, caramel, vanilla, bourbon, did I mention coffee? Sweet flavour, vanilla, caramel, bitter coffee, brown sugar. Finish coffee, caramel, malts, vanilla, brown sugar.(from 35.5cL bottle shared @ home. 2013 bottling, Los Immortales beans. 4000th rating. Thanks for the bottle, Raf!)2014 Intelligentsia Zirikana edition:More fresh coffee, same score overall.

2013 Vintage: 9/4/9/4/17

Aroma of coffee, chocolate, blackcurrants, raisins, vanilla with a big bourbon kick giving a butterscotch touch to it all. Semi boozy, less so than regular bourbon county, with more chocolate and ash, traded away with the bourbon presence, a bit fuller and rounder with more butterscotch and chocolate. Favourite bourbon county variant so far.

12oz bottle dated 2014. Roasty coffee & chocolate ganache nose. Lightly drying coffee and dried bourbon & oak cut the malty sweetness a bit. Full+ body And moderate carbonation. Liked earlier vintages better.

Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer. Pours dark chocolate with a nice tan head and nice lacing. Aromas of coffee chocolate and vanilla. Taste is smooth can taste the coffee and bourbon. A nice beer.
uma das melhores cervejas mundiais. bourbon county com muito café mas muito bem balanceado.

Poured from a bottle. Rich aromas of chocolate and coffee. Incredibly dense on the mouthfeel like oil with a flash of high alcohol. Bitterness of coffee in the finish is as big as the sweetness as it starts. Incredible beer as it is probably the best I have ever had..ever.
Excellent coffee stout. Viscous, thick, and coal-black in appearance. Aroma is just a waft of coffee, dark chocolate and dark fruit that hits you right in the face. Thumbs up!
The 2013 BCBCS was pretty close to perfect fresh. The smooth coffee flavor with a great mouthfeel.

Aromas of bourbon, coffee and a touch of oak. The malt and hops are there but overshadowed by the bourbon, coffee and alcohol. Some nice dried plum flavors.

Very sparse head; very dark brown beer with a touch of dark red to it.

Very sweet, presumably from the very high alcohol contract. A generalized bitterness, but no distinct, specific hop flavor.

Full bodied; creamy texture; average to slightly light carbonation; finish is long, finish is quite long and sweet with bourbon, coffee flavors and that general bitterness.

Overall this is a very good beer. However I rate it lower than the average RB rating; the alcohol and bourbon are just too dominate. The hops are overwhelmed and the roasted flavors of most stouts (especially coffee stouts) are also in the background. The dried plum flavors are a strength.
Not as good as the normal bourbon county stout but still pretty good. Yeah........... (Just killing characters)

On tap @ Brouwers. Pours thick viscous deep inky blacksmith thin oily dark mocha head that fades quickly to a thin whisp. Aroma is heavily roasted dark chocolate malt, fresh brewed coffee, a decided dry oaky note that follows through the finish. Taste is... whoa. Amazingly thick mouthfeel. Huge rich dark chocolate syrup with a couple shots of espresso infused comes to mind. Rich, dry, oaky finish with notes of toasted caramel and vanilla bean on the finish. Dark chocolate and espresso dominate. I dont know that this is better than standard BCS - definitely comparable in quality, and the coffee melds incredibly well with the base beer, but the original balance seems superior to me. Still, that is nitpicking here. World class beer.

Draft, decent head for what it is, faded, little lace. Aroma sweet coffee, boubon, anise, molasses, cookies and burnt sugar, smoke, oak, dark fruit deep in the nose. Taste is sweet coffee, vanilla, oak, smoky burnt sugar, anise, bourbon. Palate super rich, carbonation subdued. This is sweet, almost too sweet, but the Flavors are amazing.

12oz bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 2014 vintage.

Pours jet black with small rim of offwhite head. 

Aroma is really nice. Rich coffee and coconut. Oaky whiskey notes are pretty heavy. Subtle alcohol. 

Taste is sweet up front but balanced by bitterness in the finish. Really well done. 

Body is very full. Very rich. Smooth texture. Long long finish. 

This is a really rich sipper. Vey full of flavor.

Keg at the White Horse, Parsons Green. A half pint for £3.50 - other London pubs take note and feel ashamed. The tap label says 2011 vintage, but Ill take that with a pinch of salt. Black, small foamy brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Body is medium, slightly foamy, low carbonation. Taste is milky bourbon, lactic, chocolatey with plenty of the promised coffee, boozey finish. Very nice. May well have got a higher rating if it wasnt served so cold, but I didnt have the time or patience to wait for it to warm up.

Keg at The White Horse American Beer Festival 2015, Parsons Green, London. A black coloured pour with a thin beige head on top. Rich, bourbon, coffee aroma. Tastes rich coffee, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, sweet. A really big Imperial Stout and great to see it here in London.

Cask at Sloany Pony American bf. Pours black with dirty tan head. Smell the bourbon and coffee, taste the bourbon but not too overpowering and develops into coffee and roasts. Nice and viscous. Sticks to your ribs. Urter filth and bloody lovely.

22 oz. bottle poured into a goblet. Consumed in 2011, but I didnt record what year bottle it was. Pours a very dark black with a small tan head. No lacing. No retention. Sticky as hell. Looks like regular Bourbon County.

Bourbon and lots of it on the nose. I get the stout behind it a bit and some of the coffee, but really its a bourbon show. After a strong whiff, I actually get a strong fruitiness that I didnt get before.

Bourbon and coffee flavors mix. Its a nice blend, really. Its not too coffee forward. Has a chocolate flavor in the back and a bit of a vegetal flavor that is odd. Its all about the bourbon, though.

So boozy. So very very boozy. Low carbonation. Not too heavy, but a thick, mouth-coating stout. Its a hint smoother than regular Bourbon County.
 I dont think the coffee adds much. It adds a slight dimension. . A delicious beer, but I think its still rough around the edges.

Smells like bell peppers, enchiladas, and coffee. Medium carbonation with mild foam. Taste is very roasty coffee, alcohol taste and warmth, mild bourbon, dark chocolate, and bell peppers in the aftertaste.
2010 Bottle. Aroma and taste of dark roasted coffee, thick and dry malt bitter aftertaste, but still some sweetness. Great well balanced beer.
Finally, dont know why it took so long before I got a chance to taste this one. Glad I finally did. Its a bit to soft for me, but after all it is still a very good brew ofcourse

2012 bomber sampled at Chriss bachelor party. Black pour with a persistent tan ring after head fades. Aroma is roasty coffee with some sweet notes. Mouth feel is full body, smooth and creamy with a slight stickiness. Bourbon flavor was significantly subdued due to 2+ years of aging but was still absolutely delicious.

Weekend bottle share, A huge coffee aroma with some bourbon and chocolate, taste of coffee and bourbon- nice but not as good as the brand stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black, tiny tan head. Big coffee nose, slightly musty. Really smooth coffee flavor. Delicious.

On top at Howell and hood. 6 months age. Strongly prefer this to the normal BCS, the coffee is subtle but adds a nice taste that cuts the booze a bit and tones back the sweetness. Can't wait to try this fresh next year, as I've heard the coffee fades

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 On tap at BBDS..poured into a snifter..jet black with a thin khaki head..aroma of coffee,vanilla,licorice,chocolate..tastes of coffee,espresso,
vanilla,roasted nuts..really good.

Six-month-old bottle. Pours nearly flat, inky and black. Aroma is beautiful: rich, oily coffee beans; dark chocolate; vanilla; toasted coconut; a little caramel and butterscotch. Coffee in the flavor is slightly more bitter and biting. Dark chocolate blends into mocha goodness before a solid background of dark cherries, sweet and tart. Mild, prickly carbonation; a touch of fizz; nowhere near as much alcohol burn as there should be. Delightful.

355ml bottle enjoyed @ home, 2013 bottle thanks to Jdizzle1. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is coffee, liquorice root, wood, some earthiness, vanilla, leather and roasted malt. Flavour is sweet, slightly bitter. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is a little boozy but this is very good.

Shared bottle at "Exploding bottle tasting" at Petros place Chania. Pours very dark ruby with no head at all. Aroma of fresh grinded coffee, tar, leather and red ripe fruits in the back. Taste is distinct coffee, some toffee and vanilla, lingering sweet ,dark coffee, vey good coffee stout.

2014 bottle poured into a teku with opaque black center and coffee brown rims.

The nose is pronounced and intense yet approachable and inviting. Aromas of fresh coffee and cream, obvious hints of vanilla, bourbon, and smoke. Heavy notes of milk chocolate with slight hints of cocoa shavings. 

A lot of the same flavors on the palate. Intensity is slightly less. Definitely a lot of bourbon-like heat from the alcohol giving it another dimension on the palate. Flavors are intense but have a great longevity on the finish. Only wish I had more.
Perfection in a glass. I like it even more than the standard stout. Glad the Blackhawks sold it at the the united center.
Aroma of bourbon, strong coffee, taste is dark roast coffee, lots of chocolate, vanilla, moderate alcohol, very smooth-taste at DLD 2015.
Entering from my scorecard after having sampled at the Big Texas Craft Brew Fest.
I am shocked that this is 13%. even if you dont like coffee give this a try. It is really smooth

Bottle at 9050 tasting, thanks for bringing! Smells like lots of coffee with smoke,chocolate, some vanilla. The sweetness is not overpowering like it is with the regular one, instead it complements well with the coffee and slight smoke that this one has. Very nice. 2014 edition.

Bottle (2014 release). Pours a thick black with a scant beige head that rings the glass. Smells just like the regular BCBS: chocolate, oak, bourbon, roasted malts, slight alcohol. No significant coffee aroma, but it comes across in the taste. Big chocolate flavor, coffee, oak, roasted malts. Lightly bitter and astringent finish.

Fantastic addition to an already excellent production from the folks at Goose Island.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, courtesy of skullgeorge. Thanks Geoorge! Black color with with beige-brown head. Aroma is roasted malty, coffee, some vanilla, alcohol, wood, dark fruits, light chocolate. Sweet and light bitter taste, malty, caramel, milk and dark chocolate, light fruity, wood and alcohol again. Full silky body with soft to flat carbonation. I liked the 2012 version (La Tortuga) a little bit more.

Pours a deep dark brown with a bit of a light brown head which lingers.....aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla......taste is amazing! Thick mouthfeel, coffee, vanilla, booze, bourbon in the finish. Quite an experience.
Strong stout with nice woody notes finished with a rich roasted coffee character. Definitely a sipper

2014 bottle, thanks Shannon.
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a black color with no head nor any lacing.
The smell started off with a boozey iced coffee. As it warms, a decent chocolate flavoring adds a light spark to the aroma.
The taste was mainly the same - starts off boozey iced coffee and then adding a light chocolate to the flavor. A light iced coffee wet cocoa-esque aftertaste leads to a dry light chocolate finish.
On the palate, this one sat pretty smooth all around. Rolling coffee smooths out the mouthfeel. This one sat about a medium on the body.
Overall, I say that they was a very good D/IS.

Tasted from draft at Hunahpu Day. Had it along side the regular bourbon county stout and I like the coffee version better. Pours black with dark brown head. Big time coffee on the nose with bourbon. On the taste the coffee is much more prominent than the bourbon. Still with bourbon flavor. Chocolate, caramel, toffee, vanilla flavors also present. This might be my favorite bourbon stout. Excellent!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at a big tasting (Nördprovning 2015). Smell off dark malts, coffee, coconut, bourbon and vanilla. Similar taste. Awsome!

Pored from 12oz bottle. Perfect coffee bourbon stout. Delivers on every note! Wish I could find more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. I found the aroma very off putting. Huge green pepper and light roasted malts. The flavor was better but the green pepper was still the dominating flavor. There are notes of chocolate, roasted malts, a malty sweetness. I am shocked at how poorly crafted this beer is and all of the hype that surrounds it.
Bottle at Ashs, cheers BenH. Pours black, nose is huge coffee, chocolate, taste is roasted, toffee, sweet chocolate, coconut, vanilla, light coffee.

Thick dark brown and sticky brown head. Cut coffee beans, grean fleshy. Initial taste is sweet bitter, fleshy roast and muddy sweetness. Leafy sweetness comes through, then the bourbon later on. Little bit cleaner, brighter sweetness than the original. Bit of brown sugar melted finish, linger is fading coffee vibe and it slid down. Bottle, Cheers Glasgow Tad, Ashs Office

Bottle thanks to BenH.
Appearance - 
Nose - green coffee beans. Massive coffee.
Taste - vanilla and coconut around chocolate. Coffee of course.
Palate - medium to full bodied with a big creamy texture and a balanced finish.
Overall - its great but the nose is too coffee and that makes it single dimensional, Im afraid.
Bottle thanks to Tad. Black with tan head. Aroma stinks of coffee, some bourbon oak and chocolate. Taste is rich, vanilla, coconut, coffee and chocolate. Perfectly balanced sweetness. Delish
Bottle at Ashton McCobbs. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aromas of massive roasted coffee, green coffee beans. Taste is creamy coffee, smooooooth. Dark chocolate and coffee on the finish. Lovely.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottle Share 6.0. Blackish pour with a small tan head. Nose is fresh coffee beans, green peppers, and some light tar. Taste is fairly bitter, freshly ground coffee, cigarettes, tar and some licorice.

Small bottle from 2013. Pour is black with a small, light brown head. Aroma has lots of green bell pepper, coffee and some sweeter notes. Very little bourbon left from the original beer. Salmiak, licorice. Taste is sweet with both the malts and the vanilla, but also has some dry, oak - and of cause - coffee notes. Slight bitterness. The coffee really matches the original beer well! Very good!

2/15/15 - Another excellent Bourbon County - I liked this even more than the standard stout. Poured thick, with an excellent aroma of coffee and a hint of chocolate and fruit. Great taste, and loved the carbonated feel, the strength of the taste and alcohol. Strong, but easy to drink. Not as bitter as the standard stout, I will definitely seek out this version, and I look forward to trying others in this great line of beers! Well done Goose Island!!!

Pours tar black with a rather large-ish mocha head (served at room temp) which recedes to a ring around the glass. Aroma is a wonderful bourbon, coffee, caramel, nutty. Taste is initially caramel then hints of that vanilla sweetness recognisable in bourbon whisky which is further followed a tinge of coffee bitterness and a slight touch salty on the finish. Absolutely deserves the praise it receives, all tastes in moderation and balance. Full bodied, light, fluffy and apparent in the mouth. Long, tantalising and smooth finish.

Pours a very deep brown with s slight red tint and a small tan head. Aroma was of freshly roasted coffee, chocolate, slight cherry, and bourbon. Taste was almost identical to regular bourbon county. Didnt get much coffee and I thought I would judging by the aroma. Still very good and had a nice warming bourbon feel to it. Body was full and oily. Would love to get to have this again.

A 2014 bottle. It pours a solid black with a tan head and lacing. It has a great coffee aroma with a bourbon background. The flavor is similar, with rich, toasty malt up front and a great bourbon backbone over a thick, heavy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle from trade - hat right off to thrashD for hooking me up. Pours jet black, good old used motor oil, small ring of head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of dry roasted peanuts, chocolate, vanilla, some light bourbon booze, lightly roasted coffee beans. Lightly carbonated, just right. Deep roasted sweetness, some milky vanilla latte, some soy sauce, salt, roasted cacao, espresso, Nutella, charred meat, tiramisu... crazy range of sweet, roasty flavours. Fantastic.

Draft @ Harrys Hofbrau RWC on 1/9/15. Aroma of predominantly coffee with booze, hints of roasted malt and vanilla. Pleasant mouthfeel and tastes of coffee, roasted malt, bourbon, chocolate, and vanilla. Very solid for the stylecould drink several more of these.
2014 Bottle. Unbelievable coffee smell, thick pour no head, tons of sweet (but not too sweet) coffee flavor. Overall my favorite beer of any category.
Pours black. Huuuuge coffee nose. No lacing. Dark head. Great coffee taste. Begins a bit bitter like coffee but ends very smooth & flavorful.
Big sweet coffee chocolate aroma. Taste is huge with coffee vanilla, butter scotch, and toffee. Finish is sticky and boozy . Amazing

Bottle from Kevin, thank you very much, 2012 version with La Tortuga coffee.

Pours a viscous, black color, with a small, soon fading head.

The aromas got a hot Bourbon burn to them, wrapped up into slightly bitter, earthy coffee, with lots of bakers chocolate, molasses and toffee. The coffee acts outstandingly well with the wooden, vanilla accentuated, hot Bourbon, blending flawlessly into the rich, creamy base of the beer. Nontheless, the Bourbon stands out on itself quite well and is even more noteable than the coffee.

Drinks incredible smooth, not particularly creamy, but outstandingly silk, with calming, earthy notes to it, providing an intriguing interplay between milk chocolate and slightly sticky toffee. The Bourbon is big in this, without getting too boozy at any point, while producing a pleasant, oaken warmth with vanilla notes in it, complimenting to the slightly bitter coffee, as well as the scorched, earthy malts and sweet milk chocolate. The coffee becomes visible on the palate, paired with slick caramel and cocoa nibs, while a wooden earthiness adds to the subtle coffee sting, resulting from the harmonious, convenient integrated Bourbon. Finishes with sweeter toffee, as well as molasses and hints of coffee, while smooth, slightly sweeter milk chocolate represents the foundation of this beer.
Lots of coffee, lots of bourbon, heavely roasted malts, some chocolate, little vanilla and a dry long bitter fiinish...nice balance...amazing!
Bottle pours a very fluid black with a slight reddish hue. Aromas of coffee, cocoa, leather, and vanilla. Flavor is mild coffee bitter with a chocolate alcohol finish. Yum!!!
Black pour, brown head. Roasty sweet aroma with notes of coffee, chocolate and mocha. Flavor is the most coffee like of any beer Ive had. Like drinking a sweet, beery mocha. My thousandth rating!

Bottle, 2013 vintage. Strong coffee aroma with notes of bourbon, vanilla and oak. Pours black with a thin light brown head that dissipates quickly and no lacing. Chocolate flavors with a little bit of vanilla and oak to start. Finishes smooth with a lot of coffee flavor that lingers on the palate with a bit of booze and bourbon. Quite good for the most part, but not a big fan of the coffee.

Bottle shared by Damien and Lona. 2012 vintage. Pours an opaque black with minimal head. Aroma of coffee, booze, roasted malts, and vanilla. Taste of booze, vanilla, coffee, and some malts and chocolate.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks DSG. Pours black with a brown head, aroma of coffee, chocolate, barrel, bourbon, vanilla and a touch of coconut, flavor of coffee, bourbon, chocolate, wood, vanilla, cherries acidity, brandy, coconut, full bodied, amazing.

Heres a heavywight. Bourbon meets coffee. Aged in my cellar a year.
Really enjoyed this, coffee is solid, balanced, oily, thick, light frothy head, 
dark n roasty, smell of leather, compelling strong, burnt sugar, no joke, alcohol burn follows,
Seems thinner than regular bcbs. Dark black body. Wonderful coffee shop aroma. Sweet chocolate taste. Smooth velvety mouthfeel. Tastes like an excellent mocha latte!

Draft pour at Paddy Longs. Aroma is coffee, marshmallow, smoke, a and expresso. Poured jet black with almost no head. Sweet and creamy taste. Ends with a coffee and expresso blast you dont get upfront. So good. This is 2014. I liked the 2014 barleywine and regular a little bit more I think but this is fantastic

Poured from a tap at Brixies in Brookfield, IL. Pours dark as night with very litte, light brown head around the edges of the glass. Aroma of coffee in your face with some chocolate faint in the background. The coffee really overpowers the aroma. Also a little brown sugar is apparent on the nose. The flavor is clean, smooth, and delicious. Chocolate all the way with light alcohol throughout. Coffee comes through at the midpoint and finishes it out. The coffee is very balanced with the rest of the beer. Vanilla, dark dried fruits, and brown sugar is also apparent. Mouthful is full but clean and leaves you ready for another drink. Overall this is a spectacular beer.

Bourbon County Coffee pours jet black with a small dark brown head that lasts about 10-15 seconds. The aroma is very roasty and smokey with a bit of vanilla and coffee. The flavor is roasted coffee, a bit smokey with a hint of vanilla and some of the wood from the barrel. The flavor is very rich. Overall this is a great beer. The aroma is a little misleading as the flavor is much different than I anticipated, but the difference was a great thing. Overall this is a great brew.
I normally just taste the barrel aged beers but this one was light yet very balanced with the coffee, chocolate and barrel flavors, just enough on each that I had to order a 2nd pour from draft.

Aroma: Brown Sugar, Bourbon, Espresso

Appearance: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes No Light, Thin Brown Head Ring, Mild Lacing

Taste: Bourbon, Dark Roasted Malts, Espresso, Brown Sugar, Mild Molasses

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mild Boozy
Draft - Light bourbon and balanced dark roast coffee. Deep dark brown with a decent light brown head. Nice coffee and sweet rich toasty bourbon. Another winner.

GABF 2014. Very often I find bourbon ruins beer. Not so here. The palate is very heavy an smooth, lots of flavor with vanilla and oak, light bourbon, and the coffee actually mellowing the bourbon flavor rather than dominating in this own right.

You can smell the coffee in this stout before it even hits your lips. Some people say it is not as good as the original. If you are a coffee man, I STRONGLY disagree!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Awesome aroma of coffee bourbon and vanilla, coffee a tad lost in the flavor and a touch thin, real nice though
UPDATED: DEC 7, 2014 Good. Smells great, like a cup of coffee. Smooth with old Coffee after taste. Like vanilla rye better

12 oz bottle. Black with an small tan head. Aroma is heavy coffee, smoke, vanilla, oak, light borbon, and roasted malts. Taste is of dark chocolate, tons of coffee, vanilla, oak, bourbon, smoke, and fudge.

Bottle. The look is dark, black in color, with a real thin tan head. The smell is coffee, with berries, chocolate, pie, roasty, wood, bourbon, spicy, good. The taste is smooth, alcohol, oak, char, dark chocolate, figs, and nice. Well done.

2014. Pours jet black with little to no head and decent lacing. Aroma of green coffee, bourbon, chocolate and cherry. Taste is sweet at first with cherry and chocolate, a mild ground coffee, slight vanilla and charred oak. Finishes with a tobacco ash flavor and a warming sensation. Thinner mouthfeel than the regular with moderate carbonation. Good flavor but the coffee had a bit of a vegetal taste.

2014 bottle. Black with little crimson around the edges. Aroma is a chocolate covered cherry with a little musty coffee. Taste is alcohol immediately, but changes quickly to a dark chocolate syrup. A sweetness develops in the middle along with some vanilla and cherry at the end. Fairly roasty throughout. Not much coffee except for the same musty, earthiness that's in the smell. The mouthfeel is thinner than the regular Bourbon County. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled on November 7th, drank on November 29th. Pretty much pitch black, no head. Smells of earthy coffee, chocolate, brown sugar, vanilla, musty, a little cherry. Taste is the earthy coffee, chocolate syrup, cherry, vanilla, bourbon, oak. Mouth a little thinner than expected, but still coats. Coffee becomes more apparent as you drink, there is some alcohol burn but not too distracting. The chocolatey flavors stick around through the whole drink. Minor bit of roasted hop towards the end. Overall excellent as expected, I like it equally as well as the regular BCS, the coffee adds just a tad bit more complexity in a subtle way. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft, 2014 version  fresh! Pours faintly red tinged mahogany, small head. Aroma is intense fruity espresso and bitter Valrhona chocolate, toasted marshmallow, caramelized hazelnut, nougat, blueberry, blackberry, coffee ice cream, bourbon on the finish along with intense 99% cacao goodness and what seems like oak tannins. So big, so bold, so much coffee. Alcohol is well hidden. Great.

2014 bottling. 
The pour is jet black with a half finger cola brown head that dissipates almost immediately. The aroma is coffee ice cream, bourbon, and a tiny bit of barrel. The taste is really complex. It's like the very best coffee ice cream mixed with a bourbon shot. There's lots of other things going on like vanilla, wood, alcohol esters. It's amazing. The finish is slick and viscous. Just insane. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pitch black in color... Big bourbon aroma with prominent notes of espresso, dark chocolate... Flavor is rich and bold coffee, dominates beer, with notes of bourbon, caramel, vanilla... Coffee and dark chocolate finish.... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. This beer is dangerously smooth! Pours like motor oil with quickly disappearing head. Nose and taste is chocolate and coffee. Just a little bourbon. Outstanding!
On tap at capitol beer. Pours black with cream head. Huge coffee on this. Lots of roasted malts and oak.

2013 btl. Pour from a bottle is a nice dark chocolate with a dark tan head while the aroma has a very soft coffee note mixed with a little chocolate. Taste is a little sweet from the barrel aging mixed a strong chocolate taste. Leaves a dry after taste on the tongue.

November 2, 2014. Bottle at home, 2013 vintage. Trade with Fbc24, thanks Frank! 

Black with almost no head, a very small tan ring. Aroma is lots of cold pressed coffee, green paprika, oak, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate and light alcohol notes. Taste is bitter chocolate and coffee, sweet caramel and bourbon,warming alcohol finish. Smooth, thick and oily soft small bubble carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 This is review of 2013 vintage

Pours a jet black body, 1/4 inch tan head. Lacing was above average and head retention was ok

Smell is of sweet booze, burnt malt, dark chocolate and a little coffee. For 13 percent, alcohol scent isnt too much. 

Taste is big on fudge, vanilla, bourbon soaked oak, and slightly acidic coffee. Smoky, roasted, almost burnt malts offset the sweetness nicely. As beer warms slight bourbon after burn kicks in, kinda nice for cold weather drinking. At a year old, the coffee has faded a bit, 6 months old is probably its prime drinking age. 

Mouthfeel is nice, good amount of carbonation for a beer with a thick consistency. Head died prematurely, which prevented it from being a perfect 5. 

Overall this beer holds its own with the best of them. Rich in smell, taste, and body, very hard to find a coffee stout that rivals it. Unfortunately it is becoming harder to find but I look forward to hunting down a couple bottles every year.

Bottle:
Nearly black, with a small tan ring.
Raisin, coffee, chocolate aroma.
Chocolate, coffee, smoky bourbon flavor.
Has a definite pepper warmth and taste to it.
Outstanding.
Bottle. Vegetal, coffee, chocolate malt, and bourbon aroma. Black with small head. Sweet bourbon, green pepper, light coffee, and chocolate malt flavor. Full bodied.

The aroma is an excellent combination of chocolate, maple syrup, vanilla, bourbon, and light coffee (lighter than you would expect). It pours a dark brown, virtually black, with no transparency and a small brown head that diminishes to virtually nothing over time. The flavor starts with chocolate, vanilla, and maple syrup.

Flavor starts with lots of chocolate with hints of vanilla. Roasted coffee starts in the middle and builds into the finish. Light bourbon in the finish balances very well. I really liked the addition of the coffee.

Aroma is bourbon barrel, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, coconut. Appearance is black, light brown head. Taste is chocolate, coffee, sex, oh my god. Mouthfeel is perfect, cannot detect booze, fantastic. Oh my god. Overall, so so so so so good.

2011 and 2012 bottles->snifter. Black with tan film. Tons of coffee, roast, cocoa, bourbon, vanilla. Perfectly balanced, complex. Love this beer. Hits all of my favorite notes and characteristics. My first perfect 5.

Bouteille 12 oz. Versée dans un verre BCBS. Noire profonde avec très peu de mousse. Nez de grains grillées, bourbon et café. Bouche sur le même registre, très longue et avec une finale sucrée sans excès. Superbe.
Woodsy, coffee, roasted aromas, bourbon. Warming. Very pronounced coffee flavors, oak, bourbon, boozy, earthy.

Earthy aromas, woody, charred, roasty, coffee, some booze, whiskey, molasses. Black with a lasting tan ring of head foam. Some initial chocolaty malt sweetness, warm with boozy notes, roasty bitterness. Full bodied, creamy, warming. Delicious!

Was able to pick up a 32oz growler at a Migration event. Poured into a snifter, deep black with a foamy chocolate disappearing head. Huge nose dominated by bourbon, oak, dark fruits, and vanilla. Flavors of roasted coffee, vanilla, oak, and bourbon. Low carbonation and an oily mouthfeel.

Pours that nice clean dark chocolate color youd expect but doesnt look thick or heavy like you get with some imp stouts and has almost no head. Smells like all kinds of rich coffee, chocolate and anise. Judging by smell its tough to say if it has a big dose of anise or if its the diesel from the 14%. On the 1st sip i thought, wow theres alot going on here, but the flavors dont linger long. The beer manages to have a fresh coffee taste up front that transitions to a chocolate flavor that goes back to a roasted coffee bean flavor on the back side. Much like their regular bourbon county stout the higj abv is masked wonderfully amd its go just the right amoumt of sweet. With out a doubt one of the best stoits ive ever had.
Pour dark and thick like a good espresso. Bitter up front with a sweet vanilla finish.
Coffee forward, strong on the nose and opens bitter. Great BCBS follows after bitterness, overall a wonderful compliment of flavor to the traditional.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2015 Sampled at GABF multiple times. Black appearance with a brown head. Fresh coffee grounds, chocolate, roasted malts, oak, vanilla and light bourbon. 949518 4.5 Update: 12 oz bottle shared, purchased at Mr. Bs.  Black appearance with a small brown head.  Rich aroma of chocolate, coffee, mild roast, wood, vanilla.  Similar flavor with a incredibly smooth feel.  Mind = blown

2012 bottle. 
Wonderful aroma is both interesting and appealing.

Drinks like an imperial milk stout with coffee. A tad too sweet in the finish.

Pours an opaque, nearly black with a short-lived dark tan head. Rich, dark woody aromas and light notes of fresh coffee. Thick, smooth and chewy. Very rich brew. A lot of vanilla, bourbon, oak, and sweet cherry and fig. Not much coffee. 
Addendum:  as the beer warms, I note a lot more coffee

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2016 "this one was cool enough that i just ordered a kilo a the coffee that was in this beer. still young, and therefore a little hot. definitely sweet, but not cloyingly so. this beer, as well as the rare, makes me wonder if this beer was 10 or 11% if it would get an even higher score. the heat is the only thing keeping this from, say, a 4.7. coffee, chocolate, vanilla, charred malt...damn good all around. cant wait for the coffee beans. in 6-12 months, it may be higher in the feel." 
Last couple years are a little thick and meaty.  Really nitpicking, but docked a tenth.
Black in the glass. Strong aroma of dark cocoa and coffee. Interesting taste of dark chocolate oatmeal. Overall an awesomely solid brew! Thanks BarZigKin for sharing.

At a tasting, thanks DSG, small bubbly brown head, treacly pour, opaque quite dark brown colour, aroma of roasted coffee, espresso and green shrubs, quite aromatic, flavour of coffee, chocolate, vanila, cocoa and a touch of cherry, everything a bit too sweet and strong. Aroma is amazing, flavour is a little less so.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks DSG.  Black opaque color with almost no head. Aroma of roasted malts, espresso vanilla, chocolate, bourbon. Very rich flavors, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, licorice, caramel, bourbon, sweet and roasted aftertaste. Full bodied, smooth mouthfeel. Great brew.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks DSG. 2013. Pours black and headless. Lots of coffee, coffee beans and a little weed in the nose, along with mud and green beans followed by cocoa. Sweet and rich taste, coffee liquor, a little bitter and smooth taste. Smooth texture, no carbonation, full-bodied, long, lingering bitter coffee finish. Quite awesome.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks troganmi for this bottle! 2013 bottle, bottled 15/11/13. Black with a bit of brown foam. Really great aroma of bourbon, vanilla, coffee beans, a bit of coconut and a bit of espresso. Sweet flavor with chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, espresso and some wood and a light alcoholic touch in the finish. Full-bodied, thick. Wonderful.

2013 Bottle.Black pour with a thin ring of foam. Aroma: Vanilla beans , Bourbon , Wood , Mocha , Coffee. Taste is rich mollasses, coffee, chocolate tobacco , vanilla - exactly like aroma. Smooth and oily mouthfeel. Sweet taste , very balanced . ONE OF A KIND! Amazing!
Pours very dark. Great tasting stout with a hint of coffee and a splendid after taste.

2011 bottle, aged for 3 years. Black oil color as dark as night. Blackest beer Ive ever seen. Drank from a snifter. No head or carbonation. Coffee chocolate and burning alcohol hits the nostrils. Strong upfront coffee flavor. Smooth malty backbone. Definitely the best coffee stout Ive had. Worth the wait
One of the best coffee stouts I have had. Huge aroma. Very thick mouthfeel. A hint of coconut and lots of chocolate.
On tap at Brouwers. Coffee is very subtle. Good balance. Light bourbon flavor. Medium carbonation. Great beer.
Beer Bloggers Conference - San Diego - Super Coffee aroma and flavor. Nice bourbon flavors and finish. This was a terrific beer.

The classic used oil black. The crushed Oreo, peanut shell and alkaline soil aroma of oxygenated grounds. Flavor brings more of this, which does nothing to augment the coconut, oily chocolate, German cake flavor of the original. The peanut-like nutty earthiness the coffee offers may be likable to some, but the soil-like acrid quality turns the page quickly and harshly.

Bottle - Pours a very dark brown/black w/ tan head. Lots of coffee, bourbon, chocolate, and oak in the nose. The taste is rich, deep chocolate with coffee, bourbon, and vanilla. Very boozy but still drinkable.

Bottle 2013 vintage. Brown-black pour with a mocha ring of foam. Intense fresh and "green" coffee aroma upfront, some dark chocolate and light bourbon notes. Taste is rich mollasses, coffee, chocolate and tobacco. Smooth and round. Im not a fan of "green" coffee but it didnt bother me in this one. Delicious sipper but not the most complex.

On draught at ABV Public House. Deep amber brown color with dark brown lacing. Aroma is dark chocolate covered espresso beans, latte, cherry, and a hint of smoke. Taste is strong cold brewed coffee, dark chocolate, bourbon, oak, dark cherry, and roasted malt. An incredible stout with a wonderful addition of the coffee.

Excellent! A nice smooth coffee stout with a slight bourbon finish! Amazing how tasty with such a high ABV.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Capones. Pours black with a tan creamy head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, bourbon, vanilla, and dark fruit. Strong coffee flavor with roasted malt, bourbon, vanilla, and dark chocolate. One of the best Ive had in a long time!

355 ml. bottle @ home. Obtained in a trade with AdamJackson! Pours black with an instantly gone small tanned head. Nose is very thick molasses, syrup, bourbon, creamy dark chocolate, typical BCBS goo smell, with lots of roasted coffee, way more than expected here on my behalf. Tastes of very thick molasses, bourbon, caramel, chocolate, very thick syrupy, that BCBS syrup adorable taste is clearly here, mocha ice cream, vanilla, lots more coffee than expected, lots of real coffee bean, chocolate syrup, warming but booze is way less than what I am used with BCBS maybe the coffee covers it, the lesser presence of alcohol makes this my favourite BCBS so far because the unbalanced boozy character of this almost made them close to perfect but not cigar for me, fudge, brownie mix, thick chocolate syrup, vanilla, Insanely thick & syrupy with lower carbonation, this is insane, I love the BCBS beers so much, this reminds me of the first time I tried a RIS, this is sure an experience.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 Bottle. Pours pitch black wth a medium shortlasting mocha head. Aromas of licorice, salmiak, strong earthy coffee, light bourbon, vanilla, green pepper, strong roast. Taste has more bourbon from the base, loooots of coffee, pepper, salmiak, licorice, slight mint, vanilla, coconut. lots of roast aswell. This is well good!

Bottle 355ml from De Hopduvel, vintage 2013. Oily black colour, thin layer of brown foam. Soft carbonation. Aroma of roasted malts with sweet coffee (where is the roastiness of a black coffee?), vanilla, brown sugar and bourbon, a bit too much. This beer well balanced but its a bit too cloying sweet for me. Aftertaste of warming alcohol. I like more roastiness and ashes in stouts.

A big thanks to HisBoyElroy for the share on this want. A straight black pour with a really nice dark chocolate color head. Unfortunately the gorgeous head dissipates too quick. Very nice nose with a lot of vanilla, coffee, and bourbon. Extremely smooth stout. Very true coffee flavors. Definitely a dangerous drink. Very drinkable.

14 on draft and 12 from bottle pour at Heidelbergs Migration Week tapping. Pours a dark brown with a thin head that disappears quickly. Aromas are very coffee forward with hints of chocolate and bourbon in the finish. Taste is bourbon and a whiff of chocolate followed by an intense hit of chocolate. The 12 was obviously aged and more subdued, balanced and less bitter. Palate is very well balanced but coffee is the predominant flavor here. I prefer the 12 as the coffee seems more settled and less overpowering. More likely to the aging though.
Had a glass at the Goose Island tasting at Heidelberg. So delicious, rich, coffee is big, creamy.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 On tap at Heidelberg for a Goose Island migration week tap takeover. The pour is jet black with a thin dark khaki head and no lacing. This thing just falls to black liquid, which I love. The aroma is blasting with coffee. Incredible. The roasty malts pale in comparison, and the coffee is just beautiful. Not overly done, but nicely dominated. The flavor is just as great. Itâs a little hot, but the coffee and the rye barrels keep it from being over bearing. The mouth feel is thick and viscousy, with minimal carbonation, and a lovely roasty, molasses-y flavor to go along with the incredible coffee. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks berntholer, for sharing this one. If you would like to smell & taste coffee, earthiness, mokka ice, this is your beer. Great velvet mouthfeel. A good balance betweeen the bitterness of the coffee and the sweetness of the barrel. An excellent brew to me. Gets every sip better and better. Always interested for a trade on this one.

The beer pours dark black. Smell is mostly bourbon, vanilla and a little bit of alcohol. No coffee detected. Taste is bourbon, vanilla and chocolatey with no coffee. Oily mouthfeel with slightly too little carbonation. Alcohol is noticeable but its not hot. Overly bourbony and sweet and exactly like bourbon county stout. No coffee whatsoever. Disappointing and one dimensional.
Aroma is strong with coffee and bourbon. Taste is sweet malts with notes of coffee, bourbon, dark chocolate, oak, vanilla and of course bourbon. Palate is creamy. Very good!
Bottle to snifter - Nice and dark with a thick mocha brown head. Roasted coffee aroma and flavor. Very rich mouthfeel. This shit is good!
honestly of the BCs ive had, this is the first to underwhelm. didnt really find it all that exciting.

beige head that disappears quickly. coffee coloured. aroma is earthy, coffee grounds, coffeebeans, boozy. taste like aroma with a finish of coffee and slight sweet. quite dense body, quite carbonated. great stuff and liked it a lot more than proprietors! bottle 35,5cl / bd nov-13

Visual - The color is dark as midnight with a thin beige head.

Aroma - Smell like coffee, chocolate,oak, roast malt, and vanilla with no off odors.

Taste - a lot of coffee, sweet caramel start with littler bitter but no off flavor. 

Mouth feel - very creamy texture, thick body with low carbonation sensation. 

Overall - It is a nice beer to drink at all. Highly recommend to everyone who like to drink beer.

2013 vinatge. Pours pitch black, nice mocha head that leaves nice lacing and has quite the legs. A bit of oil of the top, taboot. Aroma is robust coffee, char, roasted nut and bourbon....lots of bourbon. Taste is decently balanced with coffee dominating the base beer. A good thing in my book. A nice thick and syrupy body helps hide the booze in this sucker. However, the barrel character always seems to become dominate as this beer warms. Just a bit too big. You cant deny the intensity of this brew because it certainly punches you in the face with flavor.

Drank with Thijs, Rik, Marijn, Bram, Thierry and Lennart during the 24-05-2014 tasting. Nice beer. Very thick, oily. Coffee taste however is not that pleasant. Still the great bourbon county taste is damn delicious.

Bottle. Lots of coffee in the aroma with a mocha and vanilla light undertones. Taste is similar to cold brew coffee with a nice nutty porter as the base. served pretty cold so it took a minutes for the booze to hit. Nice barreled stout that uses the coffee well.

30/IV/14 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from De Hopduvel @ home - BB: n/a - 2013 vintage(2014-442) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark purple to brown beer, aery beige to brown small head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of coffee, mocha, some caramel, lots of vanilla, bit dusty, fudge. MF: ok carbon, full body, creamy texture. Taste: sweet caramel start, lots of coffee, mocha, vanilla, little bitter, milk chocolate. Aftertaste: bit sourish, chocolate, coffee, alcohol burn, caramel, quite some vanilla, sweet, bit sugary. Nice beer, and I dont even like coffee beers in general!
Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. superb beer

6 May 2014, bottle. 2013 edition (Los Inmortales Coffee). black and looks flat in the bottle. nose is awesome! black coffee (slightly sweet), soy sauce, leather, burnt meat off the grill, roasted grain. full body and almost flat. Licorice, burnt steak, black coffee, chili and chocolate, mild to moderate alcohol presence. Very, very nice!

Small sample from bottle @ Zeebra II. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma has bourbon, coffee, quite some roasted malts, dark chocolate and a bit of alcohol. Taste has dark chocolate, quite some coffee, hard roasted malts and a medium bitter finish. Full body, soft to medium carbo. Nice stuff.

Bottle: 2013: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Aroma from the bottle is already intense coffee and intensly balanced.
Medium sized brown foamy head on top of a black colored beer.
The aroma is one of the best balanced aromas from a coffee stout out there: sublimely deep deepmcoffee roast with some chocolate hints, chalk tints and a marzipan bourbon edge.
Flavours of spice, pepper, coffee, coffee roast, coffee beans, coffee beans roast, chocolate, dark chocolate, some chalk, wood roast, light sweeter coal, some smooth yet stronger bitters, hint of mocha, some coffee and dark chocolate bitters and a tar sprinkle. Only the loveliest darkest things to taste!
Aftertaste is a mix of loads of coffee beans roast, chalk, dark chocolate and some "coffee bean candy" with a delicious roasty bitterness. Delicious roasted and balanced coffee tones! World class!
Low carbo, silky some spiced mouthfeel, full bodied and a oily to more silky foamy texture.
What a coffee imperial stout, the best I have ever tasted! Sublime!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Another tasty Bourbon County beer. Taste of coffee, combined with the sweet vanilla of the bourbon. Great beer.
@zebf 2014 - Roasted, toasty, almost nutty aroma. Flavour has some coffee but not so much, it feels quite spicy and the alcohol is quite warming.

Bottled @ Zeebra #2, tick. Dark color, short head. Aroma of big coffee backed up with chocolate and roasted malts. Bit alcoholic, bit sweet. Coffee is a bit too intense for me, but it is more backed up by the base beer which is also very intense. Nice one.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2015 At Zeebra Beer Festival, THX to everybody sharing todays beers.
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, no foam.
NOSE: coffee, ashes, bourbon, mocha.
TASTE: coffee, bourbon, nice.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2015 Pours a pitch black beer with a good brown head. Smells bourbon, coffee, vanilla. Tastes bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, coffee. Boojaaa. Medium body, low carbo and a sticky oily texture. Excellent!
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede bruine kraag. Ruikt koffie, vanille en gebrand. Smaakt zoetig, vanille. Duidelijk bourbon.

Probably my least favorite tonight but still awesome and better than the original. Finishes with some light bitterness. Big coffee but it doesnt control the palate. Pours black with mocha head and lacing. Roast malt. Tap at Goose Island Migration Week event at Churchkey.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 Bottle [14.3% ABV La Tortuga] @ home shared by MrHangover. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized instantly disappearing brown head. What remains is an opaque pitch black colored beer without any head. Aroma is malts, dark malts, dark chocolate, heavy coffee, bourbon, subtly alcohol, superb balanced bitterness. Taste malts, dark malts, chocolate, dark chocolate, coffee, bitter, subtly alcohol. Oh man, this is lovely. Full body, superb carbonation. Lovely. -- Adding a (short) rating for 2014 edition "Zirikana" coffee. Bottle @ home.  Opaque pitch black color, medium to full sized brown head that diminishes fairly quickly. Aroma is malts, dark chocolate, huge coffee. Taste malts, dark malts, coffee, dark chocolate, sweetish chocolate, softly bitter finish. Medium body, soft carbonation. Solid but I loved it more the first time I tried it. 8-4-8-4-14/15.

Bottle thnx to timfoolery, shared with Benzai and DutchDrebus. 2012 edition La Tortuga edition. Pours a pitch black beer with no head on top. Aroma is vineous, loads of bourbon and oak and loads of chocolate and coffee. Flavor has a lot of vineous characters as well as loads of coffee. Nice amount of booze detected. The coffee has faded a bit to the background over the years but is still present. Amazing complex, well aged beer. Great stuff.

Bottle @ benzai shared by MrHangover. Something something La Tortuga. Pitch black colour with a dark brown head that doesn?t last at all. Smells bourbon, almond, sweet, slightly barley wine, some alcohol, cocoa, chocolate, wood. Tastes cocoa, roasty, quite a lot of bourbon, almond, sweet, vanilla, a hint of red wine, port wine, some alcohol, rinse appelstroop. Full body, soft carbo, velvetty.

2012 vintage in bottle at Church Key. Pours a pitch black with cream head on rim of glass. Aroma is coffee for days along with bourbon complexity. Flavor is big and bold: coffee, bourbon, vanilla, cigar, with a clean sweet finish. Incredible.

Je commence un peu à connaître les petits racoins de Fort Lauderdale. Cest une bonne chose car on peut y trouver quelque fois des trucs comme cette petite bouteille rouge sur laquelle est inscrite la date suivante : 15 novembre 2013. Donc, ce stout de classe mondiale est ainsi brassé avec des fèves de café Intelligentsia Los Inmortales (enfin jimagine). Même versé dans un verre dhôtel, ce liquide est fier de sa robe noire et de son col haute couture. Cest au nez, par contre, que la magie opère. La fusion des éléments est assez exceptionnelle. Je dirais même parfaite. Je mets le doigt sur du bourbon, de la vanille, un fabuleux café, de la mélasse, du chocolat et du tabac à pipe. Incroyable mais vrai. Sur les papilles, les saveurs saiment et aiment ma bouche. Le café, le bourbon caramélisé, la vanille, le praliné, le chocolat, le bois et les notes rôties agissent comme une fabrique à bonheurs multiples. En bouche, je découvre un corps pleinement mérité. Sa texture riche et soyeuse tapisse ma langue. Je peux compter, heureusement, sur un pétillement nerveux bien capable, il va sans dire, de faire respirer mon palais. En finale, le café fraîchement torréfié applique une couche damertume sur le doux travail des malts et du bourbon vanillé. Un stout impérial tout simplement stupéfiant.

Nice aroma of charcoal, sweet molasses, vanilla, and some bourbon. Ebony black, traces of carbonation. Nice sweet molasses mixed with full flavor of charcoal blasted bourbon. Coffee flavor is faint, but present on the finish....glowing alcohol finish, with notes of the bourbon and sweetness. Awesome.
Hands down best stout for a reason. So smooth. Transition between flavors. Rolls from coffee, chocolate to bourbon. Epic!

One of the best beers Ive had, I was lucky to get 1 bottle of this deliciousness. Poured a deep black, oil like color and viscosity. Aroma has coffee and bourbon, with a little cocoa, and this is what the palate gets too. Fortunately, the booze is well hidden, and it is smooth.

Btl 2013 pours opaque black. Brown head that dissipates quickly leaving no lace. Smells of bourbon, dark fruits(prune,raisins,plum,fig) brown sugar,holiday cookies,alcohol, roasted coffee beans. Tastes of sweet malt,caramel, bourbon,wood, coffee and tobacco. Thick heavy body,syrupy texture, light carbonation, alcohol finish. Nice robust beer with a plethora of different flavors. Heavy, thick and chewy mouthfeel with a nice warming finish. Gonna age the other btl.

My favorite imperial stout. The coffee just makes this so much better than the plain bourbon aged stout. Impeccable pour, aroma, and color. Finished better than any beer that I have ever tried. It is work the hunt to find it. Too bad all of the stores mark it up!

Bouquet of bourbon and coffee. Pours dark chocolatey with a thin Carmel head. Tastes of
Chocolate coffee bourbon oak with an alcohol finish. Feels thin in the mouth.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2014 2013 bottle from somewhere in Brooklyn NY. Black medium carbonation, tan foam. Aroma is vanilla coffee - smells spectacular. Taste is strong vanilla, bourbon, very roasty coffee finish. ABV not super well hidden. As it warms a nice caramel flavour takes over from the bourbon character. Overall, much more drinkable than the straight BCBS. Fun and lots going on.
2011 bottle. Pours a dark brown with no head. The aroma is strong coffe grounds and roast. Thick mouthfeel with rich coffee ground and bitter roast. Held up well, very good.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2014 shared my 2012 bomber with 2 friends. poured pitch black with a non lasting beige head. strong roasted coffee bean smell, oak, wood, bourbon, smooth dark chocolate, vanilla, just one hell of a beer. smooth complex mouthfeel. well balanced beer. should be even better if there was just a bit less carbonation.. and a bit more bourbon in the taste. but again... top class!
Poured from bottle. 2013. The classic bourbon county aroma. Extremely smooth with a nice vanilla aftertaste. Lives up to the hype.

Bottle from Mackeys on NCAA Friday with ck1 & Jan - and many thanks for covering this for me. Pours an opaque black with a brown head. Aroma has sweet vanilla, chocolate, caramel and heavy roast. Taste is of sweet vanilla, roast and chocolate. Decadent and heavy, but super smooth. A touch to the sweet side, but also roasty/chocolatey deep through the body. Full bodied, and smoooooooth. Finishes strong and nicely balanced between bitter and sweet. Alcohol is more after than during, although dancing around the edges. Wonderful option for my 100th imperial stout! Find one and have it, and then have another.
2013 12oz bottle pours a pitch black with a tan khaki head. big bourbon coffee vanilla and chocolate aroma. taste is the same

Bourbon County Brand Coffee Stout 
Imperial Stout
13.4 % ABV
