APPEARANCE: Poured a midnight deep black. Very little faint toffee colored head that dissipated almost instantly leaving the smallest lace. 

AROMA: Holy Cracker Jack's, I literally just checked the bottle for my prize. The nose on this is epic, toffee, vanilla, fresh ground coffee, oak. Wow. Hints of over ripe deep dark berries. Some chocolate and a faint spiciness. 

TASTE: Right away expresso, roasted, toasted and nutty. Nice sweet malts, chocolate the ripe berries I got in the nose. Toffee, molasses and then the barrel flavor joins the party. Oak, vanilla, hint of cinnamon. Kinda happy I didn't get the spiciness I grabbed in the nose. 

MOUTHFEEL: Very rich, slick and oily. Heavy bodied with very light carbonation. Finished with a nice booziness. 

OVERALL: Amazing beer, intense and delicious. Felt it was super balanced and didn't let the coffee over power the other layers. Personally I put this right under Backyard Rye in the bcs lineup so far. 

RATING: 4.9/5 Zombie Heads!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared with Donnie. Coffee in my opinion makes about everything better and this was no exception. Thick black pour with a smell revealing bold roast coffee, heavy malts, dark chocolate, some char. Taste is sweet and savory all at the same time. Bold roast, coffee, dark chocolate, sweet chocolate, light bourbon, vanilla, oak, dark fruits. Booze is just slightly noticeable. This is fantastic.

Very well rounded aroma with coffee, caramel, and toasted malts. This is "D" Liceo us stuff. Alcohol is certainly apparent but you wont care since the heavy body more than makes up for that. Top 10 for sure.

Black pour with a small tan head. Smells like a mocha bourbon ball. Taste is similar, plenty of cocoa, coffee, oak, bourbon, and roasted malts. Abv is hidden almost completely. The flavors are interwoven so well, this is a really great beer! Props to sloth for the bottle, thanks man!

12 oz bottle, 2013 vintage. Aroma consists of toasted coconut, bourbon, dark fruit, raisins, oak, licorice. Pours opaque black with a quickly collapsing tan head; leaves a ring of foam that also disappears after five minutes or so, leaving virtually no foam. Flavor is sweet and savory with strong notes of coconut, licorice and dark fruit. Coffee isnt all that strong in aroma or flavor, actually. Oily mouthfeel, fairly soft carbonation, heavy body. Delicious, as expected, I just wish the coffee was more prominent.

Bottle share, thanks Stein! Aroma is way coffee! Appearance is black with some tan head. Taste is dark with coffee. Palate is dry. Overall, a great coffee stout. Would love to get it all the time!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Why didnt I buy more of this!@#$%^&..............FRICKIN! AMAZING!

12 oz bottle bought on Black Friday 2013. Finished a draft of a dissertation chapter so I'm treating myself to finally cracking this bottle open. Pours dark, inky, no head or lacing (but my glass was a touch wet from washing). Stout snifter glass helps the aroma. And what a smell. Coffee and rum and layers of oak. Flavor is phenomenal. The coffee comes through but doesn't overpower what is a rich barrel aged brew. I wouldn't want this every day, but I'd like it more than once! A justly praised and (I think) justly earned reward. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2100th review! 12 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 11/15/2013. Pours dense pitch black color with a small fairly dense dark tan head with decent retention, that reduces to a ring of lace that lingers. Minimal lacing on the glass. Aromas of huge dark chocolate, roasted coffee, cocoa, roasted malt, caramel, toast, vanilla, toffee, bourbon, oak, clove, light char, and roast/oak earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt, coffee, and bourbon barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of huge dark chocolate, roasted coffee, cocoa, toast, roasted malt, caramel, vanilla, toffee, oak, clove, bourbon, light char, and roast/oak earthiness. Lingering notes of dark chocolate, coffee, cocoa, toast, roasted malt, caramel, vanilla, toffee, oak, clove, bourbon, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity of dark/roasted malt, coffee, and bourbon barrel flavors; with a great malt/barrel flavor balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and full bodied; with a very creamy and slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is a fantastic BA imperial coffee stout. All around awesome complexity and balance of dark/roasted malt, coffee, and bourbon barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

A step down from the Master-class Goose Island Bourbon County Stout; but that's only to say this is a fabulous beer, not a perfect beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: the aroma is very welcoming. Its like a warmth is projected to the nose. Vanilla, coffee, bourbon, slight alcohol.

Appearance: pours pitch black. Little head and little lacing probably due to the alcohol content. This is probably the beers weakest category

Taste: the taste profile is easy and enjoyable... dark fruit, coffee, bourbon, slightly burnt wood, some licorice. Very inviting taste... no work to enjoy this beer.

Palate: sticky, thick, and lasting. As i drink the beer one sip builds onto the next sip. Like the remnants of and earlier sip amplify the next sip.

Overall: very enjoyable. I will drink this anytime i can find it.

2013 bottle drunk 3/1/14 at Sunset Grill.Lifeless appearance, dark brown, inky, perhaps not opaque due to no sediment in the bottom, but who knows.Nose is buttercream. Its intersting. Not rum-cooonut like I usually get from over-bourboned barreled beers, but still not quite right. Its certainly sniffable and mildly pleasant but...Wow, this is a lot of coffee. And a alot of malt. And not a lot of carbonation or balancing dryness.Suffice to say, I drank a few sips, was asked by the bartender how it was (after he said, "Youve never had this before?!") and all I could muster was a halfhearted "Ya, its great...". Needless to say, the intensely syrupy-sweet coffee and underattenuated maltiness was less than great.Looking around, and embarrassed to walk away from the bar with a full glass, I poured most of my glass back in to the bottle while no one was looking, took one more sip of my glass and left the rest and walked out quickly. Id write this off to having a bad bottle but come on, was my bottle the underattenuated one in the batch? did my bottle alone not carbonate. This must be what all those people who got bad batches of Angels Share felt like. I feel robbed of my $17. No not reallly...just not a good beer.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2014 2013 bottle poured into snifter. Pours a motor oil black with a khaki head that disappears quickly. Hardly any lacing. Aromas of coffee, oak, fig, bourbon, a hint of vanilla. Booziness on the nose. Flavors are lots of rich coffee, dark fruit, vanilla, smooth bourbon. The bourbon and coffee are the most prominent, and are perfectly balanced on a long finish. This is a crazy good beer. The label says it ages safely for 5 years, and I plan on testing that out. One of the best beers Ive had, easily.

2013 bottle. Pours black and viscous with a brown head that quickly fizzles away. Aroma of cacao nibs, oak, coffee, dark dried fruits, toffee, slight vanilla and bourbon. Taste of sweet dark dried fruits - especially fig and raisin, coffee, oak, toffee, vanilla, cacao, hint of bourbon. Full almost oily mouthfeel, fairly light bitterness, alcohol extremely well hidden. So smooth, sweet, dark and complex. Coffee and oak are the last flavors to linger along with a residual slickness. Crazy good beer.

Pitch black pour with a khaki head that fades fairly quickly. Great aroma, coffee beans with dark chocolate and vanilla. Taste has layers of flavor. Vanilla and bourbon are prevalent initially then chocolate, coffee, wood, and dark burnt sugar comes through. Finish has more bourbon and vanilla. Slick, full body. Great.

12oz bottle poured into a teku. Amazing coffee nose, milk chocolate, bourbon and a slight vanilla. Very smooth. Do not get the alcohol burn you get with bcs. Coffee, chocolate, dark fruits and caramel. Outstanding variant.
Poured a deep black with minimal head. The most amazing nose of coffe and stuff. In the mouth, there is a hint of heat, but in a pleasant way. A stellar beer.

Flaska från 2013. Trade (thanks biggsbowler!). Svartbrun med ljusbrunt skum som lägger sig snabbt. Doft av bourbon, vaniljstång, kaffe och nyskuren chili. Baserat på doften så bara måste det vara chili i den här biran. Dock känner jag ingen chili i smaken, möjligen att jag kan inbilla mig en diskret hetta endast. Annars är det vanilj, kaffe och bourbon i smaken. Balanserad sötma och alkoholnivå. Ingen stickande spritighet som vanliga bourbon county kan ha nu för tiden. Växer för varje klunk. Nice. Delar med Hoffback och Christofer på GHs kontor.

2013 12 oz Bottle. Tasted side by side with a 2013 BCBS. Pours black with just a slight tan ring for a head. Huge aroma of coffee, smells like my house after I just roasted some Sumatra to Full City in that it takes over everything else. Caramel and coffee dominate the flavor, very smooth. The clear winner of the variants tasting from this coffee fiend.

Appearance - black pour with no head. 

Aroma - sweet aroma. Mild coffee smell. A bit of a fruit smell. Much more prominent aroma overall than most stouts. Boozy. 

Mouth - thick and oily. 

Taste - sweet bourbon. Much more bourbon flavor than coffee. Gravity is hidden better than some barrel aged beers but still prominent. 

Overall - excellent BBA. I am not a huge BBA beer drinkers but it's excellent.

12oz bottle thanks to NHhophead! Pours deep dark inky brown-black with tiny head. Nose is musty roasty coffee and dusty cocoa, subtle dark fruits and bourbon. Taste is creamy rich earthy coffee grounds, dark chocolate, plum, raisin, bourbon. Finish is rich round fruity bourbon mingling with dusty coffee, soil, vanilla notes. Well balanced. Great stuff.

Aroma= chocolate, coffee, slight fudge smell
Taste is very similar with a nice thick, smooth mouthfeel. 
All in all very delicious beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2010 bottle, Intelligentsia Black Cat, drank this 2013. 
Black with a brown head that disappears quickly. 
Aroma: coffee, green chili, licorice. 
Taste: licorice, chocolate pralines, toffee, bourbon, coffee. 
Full-bodied. 
Very tasty, but a fresher one would likely have a heavier coffee presence.

12 oz bottle 2013 vintage- Pours pitch black with a one finger mocha colored crackly head. Aroma is bittersweet chocolate, coffee, some dark fruits, appealing. The taste is roasted malts, coffee is a little more robust in the taste, chocolate almost taking a backseat as it should in a coffee stout. Licorice and leather are in there as well. For as big of a brew as this is this is velvety smooth, alcohol is well in check. Too bad its AB-InBev, i might actually consider buying this again if it wasnt!

Bottle shared with northropfrye on Valentines Day. Beautiful dark colour. Aroma of toffee with hints of coffee. Lively on the palate. Rich coffee toffee taste with hints of raisin and bourbon candy. I absolutely loved this beer! Perfection!

2012 bottle. Thanks Brian, Bvery, for this one! Dark body with brown head, though quickly fades and not a lot of lacing. Aroma of dark chocolate, not as a coffee forward as I imagined, which is fine with me. Bread, dried fruit, bourbon on the nose, even a bit of sharpness from the alcohol. Taste is rich chocolate and loads of bourbon - definitely more of these qualities than coffee. I wouldnt say its boozy, but its definitely assertive and a bit hot. Quite an excellent beer.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2014 I had been waiting for the regular BCBS and I landed this one too this year, and man is this beer good. This is easily the best coffee type stout Ive ever had, and I like this more than the regular BCBS. Pours a deep dark black color, thick. Aroma is unbelievable: coffee, roasted malts, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate. And the taste is great. I really think the coffee stout balances out the sweet bourbon taste of the regular BCBS really well. Probably the best combination of a roasted sweet-bitter taste Ive ever had. If you ever get the chance to try this beer, dont pass it up. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Definitely at the high end of java-oriented stouts. Flavor is highly coffee. Yet still lets the base beer come thru. Super nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is got an amazing aroma and the taste is full bodied and balanced just right. Inteligencia Coffee and Bourbon Aged Stout! Nothing's better

Bottle (2013 Intelligentsia Los Inmortales) poured into a snifter. Pours a jet black with about a finger tan head that recedes fairly quick. Aromas of coffee, coffee beans, caramel, bourbon, oak, dark chocolate, light vanilla. On the taste, big coffee, roast, espresso, bourbon, caramel, dark chocolate, slight cherry-like dark fruit. Full body, semi-dry finish. A sipper at 13.4% but fairly smooth for the ABV, finishes just slightly warm. Very well done coffee-forward bourbon barrel aged stout.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2014 This is as good as anything Ive had. Pours black with soft dark mocha head. Aromas are out of this world. Massive cold coffee aromas. Then comes the bourbon and vanilla. Soon after fudge and amazing caramel. Sweet, sticky, and indulgent and rich mouthfeel. Thick and sweet flavors. Dark chocolate, coffee, bourbon and vanilla. Sweet caramel and boozy bitter chocolate to finish. This is world class and in my not so humble of opinion... better than the original. A big thanks to Maltser85 out of Fargo ND for this gem.

2013 Intelligentsia. Smells like walking into a coffee shop after they ground some beans. Taste hits you with coffee up front and then mellows with some chocolate notes. Perfection? Perfection. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle: Poured a dark black with light brown head. Very bourbon and coffee. Nice coffee bean, light bourbon, sweet but not with a rugged finish.

Bottle to snifter. Boozy vanilla with fresh coffee bean. Oily black with brown highlights. Brown head was small and dissipated quickly. Taste is coffee, molasses, vanilla. Chewy bakers bread and yeast apparent. Slick viscous mouthfeel. Moderate bitterness at the end.

So smooth. This stout is delicious with a great bourbon flavor throughout. The coffee is perfectly blended with this stout, not to strong and not too weak. It really is just right. This might be even more enjoyable than the original Bourbon County in my book. One of the best imperial stouts on the planet, bar none. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2014 Pours opaque black with a tan head coffee aroma with sweet bourbon. Hint of chocolate and plum. Brown sugar. Full bodied. Soft carbonation. Chewy. Long smooth finish. Amazingly balanced for the abv

Black pour with deep tan head. Aromas of coffee, cinnamon, sweet malts. Flavor is more of the same, coffee is bitter, mild alcohol presence, bourbon, chocolate. As it warms its generally just a liquid chocolate covered espresso bean...with bourbon...delicious.
Paid a lot for this bottle to-go and it was worth every dollar. Delicious!!
So dark, and velvety... Tastes and smells like coffee with cream in it. So amazing. Its going to be hard to keep one of these for five years.

The perfect beer? Quite possibly. Tasted along side KBS and blew it out of the water. Huge coffee wave on the front, almost mocha. Velvety, chocolately, the perfect amount of char/smokiness. Bourbon comes through nicely for a 2012, and last the whole time. Great throat burn, soothed by the intense vanilla and buttery sweetness. Thick 1/4 tan head, held for a couple sips before the glass turned to that beautiful used motor oil look. Highly recommended beer.

Thanks Jesse! 12oz bottle into a mini snifter. Jet black viscous pour with minimal mocha film head. Aroma is straight coffee, dark fruits, chocolate, bourbon. Taste, again with the rich smooth coffee, bourbon, vanilla, roast, slight oak. Sticky motor oil consistency. Smooth!

2013 Bottle. Sweet boozy bourbon, earthy coffee, dark chocolate, woody vanilla aroma. Black with a small tan brown head. Sweet boozy whiskey, earthy coffee, dark chocolate, and vanilla flavor. Full creamy body, moderate carbonation. A great big huge boozy sipper.

Jaw-dropping beer. Poured into a snifter from a bottle. Poured jet black with a light brown head that dissipates almost immediately. Nose is class BCS with huge black coffee that almost completely over powers everything. Taste follows suit, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla at the front all washed down with overwhelms black coffee. Slight booziness is the only draw back, could use a bit of age if it's hot. Could hardly recommend a beer higher.

A: black with tan head
S: coffee,bourbon
T: bitter from coffee
M: smooth 
O: one of the better coffee stouts I've had.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2014 12 oz bottle poured into a snifter. Pours a black color with minimal tan head that leaves light lacing. Smells of coffee, chocolate vanilla and bourbon. Tastes of the same things in the smells with a little caramel there as well. Mouthfeel is unbelievably smooth, silky and creamy. Great carbonation as well. This is the best barrel aged stout I?ve had to date. Great use of ingredients and it?s very complex. I?ll be seeking this one out again for sure.

2013 batch. Pours extremely dark with quickly dissipating tan head. Smell is bourbon, vanilla, coffee, chocolate and alcohol. Taste is very rich chocolate and bourbon with a great coffee balance throughout. Phenomenal brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a dark chocolate color in a balloon glass with little head.

Immediate Bourbon and chocolate in the aroma. As the beer warmed up, more layers of chocolate, coffee,and vanilla.

Mouth feel is moderate.

The taste is highly complex. Layers of chocolate, vanilla, coffee. The finish has a strong Bourbon presence.

The chocolate and Bourbon seem more pronounced in this beer than the Bourbon County stout. The Bourbon whiskey finish is wonderful.

The beer should be served no colder than 50F. As I warmed up the beer from 48F, i noticed a big difference in a few degrees F. At 50F, the coffee kicks in, and the Bourbon becomes stronger. The peak temp should be about 55F. Higher than this, the beer loses some of its intense flavor. Fantastic beer!

Simply the best stout I have ever had. Period. A must try. So smooth and delicious!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle - 2013.
Hardly roasted nose with fine chocolate and toffee notes in the background. Mouthfeel is cramy with a perfectly balanced bitterness and alcohol touch. Taste dominated of dried fruits and oak. Coffee and chocolate up front with faint hints of fine spices like cloves and white pepper.
A pitch black beer with a fine brown head...that is a true beauty in the glass

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is java, chocolate and coffee. Roasty, bourbon and vanilla. Boozy, but great. Has brown head with black body with brown edges. Tastes chocolate coffe booze bourbon. Delicious.
I cant imagine a tastier beer. Great aroma with hints of bourbon and toffee. Top 5 Ive ever had.

This is it folks! I never thought I'd rate a beer as perfect but I can't find a damned thing wrong with this one. The aroma has sweet and bitter coffee notes. It pours like tar out of the bottle. The taste is powerful. Has a nice alcoholic warmth with lovely coffee flavor along with the smooth thickness. Oh god! This is just perfect.

Bottle, 2013 vintage, 01/08/2013. Pours dark black, sparse hazy tan head, slight lacing, fading to an almost still surface. Aroma is rich, fresh coffee grounds, nutty and bit oily, vanilla cream and cocoa, dark toffee, bourbon well integrated in the background. Taste is vanilla caramel cream mixed with chocolate, dark roast with delicious coffee finish, mild bourbon in the aftertaste. Creamy smooth body. Really delicious, does not disappoint at all.

Holy fucking hell. Bottle, pours motor oil black, no brown edges. A vigorous pour yields a dark mocha head that recedes to a ring of fizz. Massive, coating alcohol legs on the glass. A whallop of black coffee on the nose; digging deeper, some dark chocolate and bourbon-y vanilla help balance. Full and soft on the palate, a whipcrack of alcohol, though fleeting. Gorgeous.

Wow that's coffee flavor! Wow 

Liked it. Not as much as the other but the same company that I tasted. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rich black color; Heavy creamy body; Aroma of smoky malt, oak, vanilla, coffee, bourbon, & licorice; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel, molasses/syrup, rich coffee/espresso, chocolate, and dark fruit (notably plums); Warm finish; Nicely balanced & complex; Excellent stout - but I still prefer the standard BCS.

2013 Los Inmortales. Coffee, booze, toffee aroma. Pours black with almost no dark tan head that rapidly fizzles away. Candy toffee mocha sweetness balanced with a coffee/espresso bitterness and a nice boozy warm finish. So amazing.

Last minute substitution by max at clocking new year. Pours deep brown with thick pillowy head. Nose of deep coffee. Tastes of rich coffee, some chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, earth, some dark fruits, and light piney hops. Thick and full bodied but not cloying.

Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is very strong coffee, burnt, sweet. Very rich chocolate, great coffee flavors, creamy, very full, slightly burnt. A really solid, great coffee stout! Very yummy!

Beer is pitch black with a small head but pours very thick. The nose has coffee up front with vanilla and oak. Taste is more coffee with an alcohol punch. The finish is long with some roasted fruit. Great beer.

Bottle from 16 Tons Taphouse, Eugene. 2013 bottling. Pours very dark opaque brown/black. Little to no head. Lots of coffee in the nose, sweet nutty notes as well, very little Bourbon. Body thick, rich, full, finish complex with coffee bitterness and Bourbon bite. Nice but not the best ever.

2013 bottle poured into a snifter. Black with a fast-fading tan head of less than 1 finger. Aroma of serious coffee grinds, hints of bourbon and roasted malts. The taste is basically perfect. Coffee, bourbon, dark chocolate, roasted dark malts, a little caramel, oak barrel, a little alcohol. Mouthfeel is typical of bcbs plus espresso and some warming alcohol/syrups. Sooo damn good!!

2013 bottle. 
strong aroma of coffee, chocolate, sugar, vanilla, cream, tiny bit of bourbon. Taste is very sweet but delicious. Fairly strong alcohol finish, warming in my chest. Roasty, toasty, chocolate, and booze. delicious.

Bottle (2013, fresh). Pours black with a boozy ring around it, nice tan head. Aroma is intense coffee, caramel. Taste is huge punch of coffee - bittersweet, strong, and complex. Some sweetness here but nothing along the lines of the Backyard Rye from this years releases. More subtle, caramel/toffee tones. A little bitter finish. A fantastic release.
Draught at Churchkey. Pours black and still. Aroma is too much like a sweet dark roast coffee. Flavor is just a lot of Bourbon and coffee. Feel is sticky heavy and dull. Boring and overwrought.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 2012. Bottle, which broke upon opening. Filtered through a coffee filter to avoid ingecting glass shards. Pours black. Had a nice beige head in the filter, but thats gone now. Aroma is spent coffee grounds, bourbon. Flavor is heavy on the bourbon, with dark malts, dark fruit, and a bit of coffee bitterness. This is pretty amazing.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 12oz bottle (2013 vintage) from Fisher Blvd Spirits. 1st beer of 2014! Happy New Year!! Pours black with a nice two fingers of frothy dark mocha head. Fades fast to nothing. Aroma is bourbon forward, with notes of rich espresso, barrel, dark chocolate, burnt caramel, and vanilla. Taste of bourbon, sweet caramel, vanilla cream, barrel, dark chocolate, and rich coffee.
Aroma is of dark coffee. Mouthfeel is oily and thick. I taste soy sauce in here too.

Bottle at home. Pours a motor oil black with a thin head that disappears rather quickly. Almost no signs of lace along the sides of the glass. The aroma is of strong coffee with a slight hint of boozy bourbon. Taste is right in line with the smell, strong notes of fresh coffee with the slightest touch of bourbon and vanilla. Perfection. Warm mouthfeel and well balanced.

I havent had Many Goose Island Bourbon County variants but i,ve been mostly let down by the few i,ve had. Coffee is no less disappointing.No head, carbonation, too sweet and boozy, not near enough coffee flavors or aromas.A mess. Ya,ll enjoy. One over rated puppy.The original still owns it and IT aint all that.

Black with rich brown head, thin. Aroma/flavor of fruity coffee, dark chocolate, cloying BBQ sauce, some soy sauce, and sweet. Cloying, way too much. Super-heavy body. even 12 ounces would be too much, so Im glad I split it with friends. An interesting experiment, but too heavy in my opinion (for my enjoyment).

Bottle, 2013 vintage. Pours an oily viscous black with a brown head. Aroma is heavenly; bourbon notes with a big up front coffee kick and some vanilla. Flavors follow the aroma; Coffee is well integrated, but very much present, a nice warming alcohol at finish, and a creamy coconut/vanilla flavor in the midpalate. This is really exceptional, perhaps a bit hot still... will let the other one sit for a bit.
Bottle at Vail. Thanks to adnielsen for sharing. Pours a black color with tan head. Nice big coffee, roasty, burnt, oak aromas. Coffee, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla flavors. Pretty fucking nice.

Pours thick and dark. Smells sweet, of coffee, and caramel. Tastes strong of coffee, alittle bourbon, sweet molasses, and boozey. Overall it tastes similar to original but not as sweet and with a nice amount of coffee , which is nice. Overall fantastic!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle to glass. Jet black with reddish brown head. Aroma is coffee, vanilla, roasted malt, chocolate, ethanol. Mouthfeel is fantastic with medium body and nice carbonation. Taste is sweet with a slight astringent following and slight CO2 bite in the finish. Overall this is a really nice brew full of coffee, chocolate, slight bourbon, and vanilla. Fantastic.

2013 bottle-fresh pepper, cocoa, coffee pours a deep black with a rich spritzy all most milk chocolate head that dissipates fairly quickly. Rich and malty with chocolate, coffee, vanilla, bourbon. Also a touch of creaminess with a dry escaping finish that just leaves hints of coffee and chocolate with a pleasent warming effect.

Single 12oz bottle picked up for $4.99 on Christmas Eve... Pours very dark brown with a short lived brown head. Nose is sublime; a coffee lovers dream come true. So rich, fresh, bright, and intense. Roast and barrel notes to balance. Coffee flavor is solid... good roast and character. Nice bourbon compliment. Excellent.

Santa beer! Thanks to drowland. Pours jet black and oily. Nose of sweet bourbon, roasting coffee, sugar. Taste follows perfectly. Sweet, bitter, and warming. Coffee taste is there, but not overwhelming. Perfect Xmas morning sipper.

Bottle 2013 vintage - pours opaque , mocha colored head that quickly dissipates . Big espresso and milk chocolate aromas . Tastes of roasted coffee beans , mild bourbon , and sweet cocoa . A great F - ing beer . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Thick oily black, no real head or bubbles. Aroma is rich of chocolate, roast malt, booze. Some coffee.. Probably lost a lot, but a rich chocolate, caramel, and sweet syrup. Great stuff, thanks tommy!
Bottle la tortuga bottled 11/12/12 0017 aoma and taste big on alcohol and coffee. Full flavor beer with a creamy plate.

Opaque black... Total aroma bomb, bourbon, coffee, chocolate, smoke...
Taste, follows nose perfectly 
Very solid brew, one of the best.. Lives up to the hype perfectly.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled on November 15, 2013 printed on label.

Appearance: Pours a motor oil black with a 1 finger toffee brown head which dissipates quickly leaving a ring around the edge of the snifter. Minimal lacing which I would imagine is due to the elevated ABV.

Smell: Loads of fresh roasted coffee alongside notes of bourbon, cocoa and vanilla. The bourbon notes really come out as it warms.

Taste: A perfect mix of cocoa, sweetened coffee and vanilla up front followed by delicious bourbon notes in the middle before ending with just a light amount of dark roasted malt at the finish. Aftertaste is mostly sweet with just a hint of bitterness and a touch of coffee. Extremely well-balanced beer. The alcohol is very well hidden.

Mouthfeel: Full-bodied with a good amount of carbonation. There is a mild alcohol burn as it goes down due to the ABV. Just a touch thinner than Id expect from a big stout like this. 

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. A very smooth beer that goes down way too easily for 13.4% ABV.

Overall: World class beer overall. The hype behind this one is there for a reason. Its amazing and Im glad I got a chance to try it. This is truly one of the best beers Ive ever had the privilege of drinking. If you get a chance, this beer is absolutely worth seeking out.
2012 bottle. Pours jet black with small tan head. Aroma of slight coffee and chocolate. Taste has coffee there but definitely faded and muted. Nice for a year old coffee stout.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottle of the 2013. Colour...certainly black, with a wisp of a tan head. Nose...redolent of coffee with mocha and cocoa powder. Palate...thinner than I imagined but that doesnt prevent the flavour from coming through. Coffee is of course at the forefront but it is not "in your face" like so many coffee stouts (and Im not a coffee drinker). Theres dark chocolate here and chocolate fudge cake with choco-coffee ganache. The finish is smooth and velveteen and I have a feeling that the coffee helps temper the high ABV.

This imperial stout was made nov. 13th 2013. It pours thick like motor oil. definitely opague over 40 srm. I was unimpressed with head as it barely formed and dissipated rather quickly. The carbonation is very low flat even, The nose is heavy on coffee and booze reminds me of a whiskey coffee. The taste seems to have an overtly instant coffee taste that melds into licorice, vanilla, raisin, dark chocolate,caramel, toffee with a very dry taste that lingers on the palate. The instant coffee taste really seems to linger and it has a very boozy aftertaste. I would like to try this again when it had time to mature longer i think some of the faults might mellow out and make this imperial stout better.

If there is a better coffee imperial barrel aged stout let me know. This thing is huge coffee with an almost milkshake like texture. Taste is barrel aged stout and mad coffee. The taste lingers forever and the most pure taste of coffee I've ever tasted in a beer. Unbelievable.

12oz bottle, thanks to nimbleprop. Massive amount of coffee dominates everything, both in the nose and taste, with bits of chocolate too. Very thick and unctuous, making the flavor last forever. Incredible

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2014 Midnight black, thick pour with a quickly receding finger of head.

The aroma is to die for, like sticking your head into a bag of fine, fresh roasted coffee beans.

The flavor opens up, beginning with powerful espresso notes, and segueing seamlessly into deep, dark chocolate, followed by vanilla beans, and finally, lovely bourbon.

The body is syrupy and rich, although perhaps a bit thinner than regular BCBS, due to the coffee infusion.

The finish may also be a tad less lengthy, but the intensity is greater, as it positively envelops the palate in a crescendo of flavors.

This is, hands down, my favorite coffee stout, and perhaps my favorite stout in general. Well worth the hunt.

2010

pours ink black, some mocha foam and no lace. typical BCBS styling. Smells like BCBS and coffee, maybe some dark prunes and vanilla. Its nice. Flavor follows suit with a good bourbon and vanilla kick followed through with a solid mocha tone. Thick bodied with subdued carb as the beer warmed. I like this one, I like it quite a bit, but not on the seek out level in comparison to the regular BCBS. 3/4.5/4.5/4/4 - 4.28

2011
Same look as before. Smells strongly of coffee, too much for me. Below, when I seek it out, the bourbon and stout characters come through, but its too much work. Flavor is richly coffeed and with a solid sweet stout accented with bourbon. Full bodied and fleeting carb similar to the 10. Im not a big fan of this one, although my drinking buddies dig it quite a bit. 3/2.5/3.5/4/3.5 - 3.33 (this is the grade that is recorded)

Serving type: bottle

06-28-2012

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2014 [2012 bottle / fresh] Thanks, Alex! Extremely black center with dark brown trim, topped with a slowly rising, micro-bubble tan head. Aroma is so "deeply" roasted; huge notes of dark, roasted, grainy, raw, oily coffee beans... Pure with light bourbon, oak, faint vanilla, cocoa powder, & some brown sugar. Amazingly fresh & vibrant, evolves with time. Taste is creamy, smooth, & silky. Columbian roasted coffee with hints of bourbon, bitter cocoa, dry oak, a touch of vanilla & coconut... I even get a mild spiciness in the finish, seems like chilies almost. Lingering aftertaste of roasted malt, coffee, light oak-y bourbon, & brown sugar. Fantastic stuff.
[2012 bottle / 1 year old] Thanks, Mike! Though the coffee is a bit dialed down, it is still very much present, & this beer is smoother than ever. Integrated flawlessly with literally no burn. Coffee, chocolate, oak, vanilla.... Great stuff as always. Even a year does not "fade" it.
[2013 bottle / fresh] As good as the aroma was before, its amazing this year. Like an elegantly blended cup of joe with a perfect amount of bitterness to the roast & enough creamy sweetness to balance. Nice burnt, caramelized sugar undertones with a mild dark fruit aspect in the finish, too. Smoother than the 2012 was fresh. Amazing as always.
[2013 / bottle / 1 year old] This vintage still might be my favorite. Even with a year on it, the coffee aroma is so deep, so roasted, so intense. Beautifully smooth in the palate. Still loaded with coffee. Youd never guess it was a year old. Fantastic.
[2014 / tap / fresh] Out of the gate, this one is less coffee forward in both taste & flavor than previous batches (even aged). Less of that "intense & deep" roasted, oily coffee bean presence. Still a great beer, but probably one of the weakest years Ive had, based on the timid coffee presence, even when super fresh.

From a bottle, pours dark black. Aroma is huge with coffee and chocolate. Taste is very sweet. Too sweet. Not as much coffee in the taste as in the aroma, which is fine. Very rich. Mouthfeel is slippery and full.

The beer pours an inky, midnight black, much like regular BCBS, a dark tan head briefly forms and then fizzles away to a scrim; the head is slightly lighter than the head that forms on BCBS. In body, the beer is thick, viscous, and opaque, and when swirled, the beer leaves a brief set of alcoholic legs on the glass. On the nose, the beer shows its departure from regular BCBS. Rich fruity coffee buffets the nose with just a trailing hint of spicy solvent and alcohol. The coffee smells of a beautiful medium roast, moving from cocoa beans, to touches of vanilla, dark chocolate, earth, cinnamon, nutmeg, and even a touch of chili powder as the coffee interacts with the spicy alcohol. This beer has a truly delicious nose to it, reminiscent of sticking your head inside a bag of fresh coffee beans. The stout beneath the coffee does get a little confused in the richness of the coffee, blending in places, and muting in others, but Im not all that disappointed by that as I see this beers nose as a vast improvement over the boozy BCBS. The barrel is light in the nose, but seems to be contributing to the vanilla notes, and perhaps also the slight boozy notes. On the tongue, the beer tastes richly complex, blending fruity coffee, rich bourbon barrels, and boozy stout. Sweetness pairs well with the bitters of the coffee, creating a nearly chocolaty sweetness, while rounded tannins lightly touch the finish and provide mild structure in the mouth. Coffee acidity is also present, giving the beer a slight tingle. In flavor, this beer is far superior to BCBS at this age. Rich, fruity coffee beautifully blends with the barrel as the beer touches the tongue bringing fresh medium roast coffee, prunes, earth, and rich dark chocolate flavors. Vanilla and soft oak dance alongside the coffee notes as faint roasted malt character is sensed along the edges of the flavor. As the beer splashes over the back of the throat, hot alcohol does come through, providing spicy notes of cinnamon to coincide with the rich coffee flavors as the coffee is slightly muted. The finish is briefer than BCBS, bringing notes of raw coffee beans, and then freshly brewed coffee, as well as spicy alcohol. In the mouth, the beer is full and slippery, feeling thinner than BCBS but still full with a silky mouthfeel and weak carbonation. The beer remains chewy and luscious, though the coffee has certainly diluted the initial fullness of the beer. Alcohol is smooth and warming, with just a touch of bite. Overall, I like this beer more than I like BCBS. Ill admit that part of that is how the coffee hides the alcoholic bite in this beer, but Im also a coffee-lover and the coffee flavors found in this beer are rich and complex, beautifully blending with the barrel aging. This beer is not KBS, however close it might come, and does still carry some booziness in the finish. I wouldnt age this bottle for more than a couple months, seeing as how the awesome coffee flavors will die out, but I would certainly advise picking up a bottle and trying this puppy out. Good stuff.

2012 Bottle to glass. Pours a thick dark black color with a small fizzy brown head. Very potent aroma with coffee, roasted malts, dark fruits, booze, anise? Sweet bitter chocolate, coffee, dark malts, heavy booze in the flavor. Relative moderate body, given such a big beer, not too thick. Quite a boozy punch in the finish. Almost like a dessert wine. Delish.

Bottle poured a black hue w/ small fizzy brown head fully diminishing and no lacing. Moderate bourbon aroma. Initial flavor is bold sweet w/ a light bitter finish. Tastes are bourbon, rich medium roast coffee, toffee, molasses, brown sugar, and oak. Full bodied, syrupy mouthfeel, soft carbonation, and huge boozy warmth in the finish.
2013 12oz bottle purchased at Brewforia Eagle a few days ago. Dark, thick brown, aroma exploding with coffee. Rich and intense. Pretty much exactly what I was hoping for.

2013 bottle. I dislike coffee so I'm glad I got to try it without opening mine so I can trade mine. This smells like more coffee than I've ever smelled. This is bleh and my score is for my future use. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 12oz bottle. 

Poured dark brown, almost black. Half finger brown head. Aroma of a good, strong, dark coffee. That coffee comes through nicely in the flavor, along with a very pleasant and complementary chocolate and stout flavor. Aftertaste favors the choc/stout. 

Very possibly my favorite coffee stout. (But of course, further testing will be needed.)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tallahassee, Fl - Market Square Liquors - 12 oz bottle. Inky black pour, initial foamy khaki colored head that settles after a while. Aroma is the highlight of this one with some sweet tiramisu note, whiff of bourbon and the smell of a coffee grinder as it is grinding your dark roast coffee. Big bold flavor with a bourbon front end onslaught, some strong espresso notes hanging around in the back end, some creosote, a hint of licorice. Mouthfeel is thick and syrupy. Great in all individual parts, just the cloying nature of if brings down the overall score. 12 oz was more than enough!

2013 Bottling. One of the best coffee stours Ive ever had. The nose perfectly balances the bourbon, the stout and the coffee. The coffee is definitely prominent but it doesnt dominate everything completely. Likewise the palate is huge and thick and chewy as you would expect from a bourbon county stout. Flavor is a perfect balance. Not to sweet, not to bitter. The roast character and the bourbon interplay with huge vanilla, tobacco, chocolate and raisin notes. The only areas that keep this from being the perfect beer is that its nothing incredibly mind blowing like BA Hunahpus, BA Abraxas, Morning Wood, or Kentucky Brunch. And the appearance while nice is not as awe inspiring as some other stout offerings. Minor quibbles all, this is an amazing beer.

2013 Bottle to snifter. Pitch black body with a thin mahogany Brown head that dances around the edge of the glass a bit. Nose is really strong dark coffee that cloaks a body of bourbon with vanilla, chocolate, and oaky vanilla notes; almost buttery. Taste is a good mix of coffee and bourbon up front that splits into a smooth buttery vanilla body, to a coffee bitter finish that is perfectly warming. Sweet cherry notes throughout. Amazing beer.
On tap at rustico! Pours black with thin tan head, aroma is great roasted coffee and bourbon, taste is huge malt and coffee and bourbon! Soo smooth, soo good

12 oz bottle. 2013 vintage shared. Jet black. No lacing. Huge nose of coffee, oak, vanilla, and a hint of cinnamon. Huge her with a huge taste. Boozy and full of barrel characteristics. The balance of the coffee really pairs well and cuts down on the astringency. It makes the beer much more balanced and enjoyable. Dangerous.

2013 bottle had less than a week after release. Massive high end coffee nose. Deep black and viscous. Rich coffee flavor, with slight herbaceousness and soft dark fruit. Coffee bitterness really cuts through the sweetness compared to the regular I tried beside it...very different beers but both ultimately great in their own regards. Agree with others: smoke em if you got em.

Surprised I havent reviewed this one yet (this bottle is one of the couple the COOP could provide me. I am very appreciative)

Years ago, Inflatablechair hooked our tasting group with the 22s of this one plenty of times. Tonight a 13 12oz is all mine. A short-lived dark brown head rises only about a quarter inch up and dies very quickly... the brew pours thick and very smooth.

The nose is for the most part hammered with coffee beans... not "ground coffee" but cracked coffee beans... there is a nice cocoa element that doesnt really rise up until things warm considerably... the bourbon/barrel presence is not as much as I remember in the 1st batch, but it is still certainly present.

Flavor mirrors the nose with a strong dark fruity element.. a big figgy component that adds needed sweetness... the malts help balance the big coffee bean presence.. very nice chocolate waves sorta envelope the entire palate.

Huge body is no surprise... mild carbonation begs for a sip and contemplation.

Dont age this one... Not worth it.

2013 Release 12oz Bottle A - Pitch black, mocha colored head that dissipates quickly, nice lacing. S - Huge intense java nose! Tingling alcohol. T - Roasted coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, wonderful sweetness, alcohol warms the chest on the way down, bourbon barrel notes take a back seat. M - Slick mouthfeel, full bodied, bitter-sweet coffee finish. O - Intense, wonderful java bomb.

Bottle from Proof. Pitch black pour with a dense brown head. Huge coffee aroma, cocoa nibs, coconut, vanilla beans, oak, sweet bourbon with a hint of dark fruits. Sweet chocolate on the front of the tongue, powdered cocoa, coconut, vanilla, bourbon in the mid palate, roasted malts and charred oak coming through in the back end. Rich bodied and soft carbonation. Alcohol heat isnt that noticeable. Goddamn delicious.

Pours a pitch black with a small tan head with nice lacing. Aroma is of gourmet coffee, roasted malts, licorice, dark fruits, bourbon, molasses, vanilla, and a little booze. Taste is similar to the aroma with the addition of some tobacco notes and some cold brew iced coffee flavors. Has a full body with creamy, oily mouthfeel, and a moderately bitter, long finis. Overall, a very nice imp. stout that is just as good as original BCBS and features coffee from one of my favorite roasters nicely.

2013 release, opened 11/30/13. Pitch black, with no head to speak of. Huge, dark roasted coffee on the nose, with a bourbon oak background. Almost like smelling fresh ground coffee, with hints of chocolate and vanilla. Perfect mouthfeel. Tons of dark coffee, but almost no astringency at all. Smooth, but not sweet. A finishing alcohol heat leaves an aftertaste of dark chocolate, more coffee and some of the vanilla bourbon notes. Amazing

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2014 Pours pitch black and very oily, with a small dark brown head. Huge roasted coffee on the nose, vanilla bean, dark fruits, caramel, bourbon, and a hint of oak. Wow, this tastes incredible. Again, lots of roasty milky coffee up front, strong oak and bourbon, molasses, earthy chocolate taste, and hints of vanilla bean. Smooth, silky goodness. Leaps and bounds better than KBS, and definitely an improvement over regular BCBS. So much going on, so complex and not just another bourbon bomb. Thank you for not messing this up, AB Inbev.

11/24/13. Given to me in a trade for TH growlers. 
As much as I loved regular BCBS, this coffee version raises the bar even higher. 
Every rating of every category would be rated as excellent. 
I'm not wasting anymore of my time writing about it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Local distribution (briefly) in South Florida. Picked up two 12 oz bottles. Snifter pour. A very dark brown, thick pour with a thin mocha head that disappeared quickly. The aroma...WOW the Aroma. I love coffee and expresso. Nose is overwhelming coffee, dark chocolate, and roasted malts. Taste was amazing with expresso, dark chocolate, roasted malts and a hint of heavy leche. Thick, full, chewy body. Not oily but full of lactose thickness. Mild carbonation. Finish is strong coffee and cocoa nibs.

Keg @ Churchkey. 2013 vintage. The pours deep brown with hardly any head whatsoever. Strong roast coffee dominates the nose. Charred earth, brash espresso. Dark chocolate. The taste is thankfully a bit more rounded. Boozy wood, caramel, dark chocolate. Slight coffee acidity. Toffee candy finish. Big, fat body. Syrupy and thick. Light carbonation. Overall, pretty tasty indeed.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2014 Aroma: medium roast coffee, brown sugar, vanilla bean, fried nutmeg. Appearance: pitch black with very little head. When head did appear, it was medium brown. Taste: bitter coffee, sweet fudge. Palate: creamy/oily mouth feel. Slightly harsh finish. Coats the mouth.
Bit too much coffee for my tastes; this feature is better as an aroma than a taste.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2015 Updated after bind BA coffee tasting. BS Coffee was the clear winner, great vanilla, coffee, barrel mix. World class beer.

Bottle. Pours pitch black. Aroma is all coffee. Maybe some chocolate. Taste is strong coffee, chocolate, vanilla, oak. Very yummy. Better than Barleywine? depends on your preference... I say yes.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2014 12oz bottle. Big coffee, toasty, and chocolate. Nice color with small tan head. Tastes of bittersweet chocolate, coffee, bourbon, with a lingering sweet and boozy finish. I?m not big on coffee stouts, but this one is a winner.

12oz bottle. Pours black with small beige head. Powerful coffee aroma. Incredibly sweet with intense chocolate notes. Full bodied with creamy mouthfeel and lingering sweet, somewhat roasty finish. Great example of an imperial stout.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2014 Bottle. Nose is a coffe bomb. Way coffe. Minimal head. Taste is coffe with some booze. Little roast. Freaking awesome. Perfect meld of awesome with a little note of more awesome. Wowe.
Pours a deep dark black color. Huge straight up coffe in the aroma, light sweetness and roast. Big boozy roast and coffe flavor. Alcohol very present but covered by big flavors.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2013 Sample via a friend. 
No head. Clear black pour. Awesome brew. Nice coffee. Very smooth.

Cheeky rating, sampled at kermis birthday, thanks! . Pours dark brown with no head
Aroma is vanilla, chocolate and lots of coffee. Flavour is deep smooth, quite sweet and lots of bourbon. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Great.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Dark opaque black color, small brownish head. Aroma has intensive vanilla and some coffee. Full-bodied, liquerish palate. Sweetish vanilla, cocoa and coffee. Sticky and tasty.
Bottle share poured into snifter, probably one of the best aromas Ive ever smelled in a beer. Bourbon, chocolate, coffee. Silky smooth. Right up there with the standard Bourbon County.

Bottled 11/12/12. Dark pour thats black/brown, dark brown head thats very thin. Heavy wheaty malt that smelled like kraft mac and cheese powder at first. Once the beer warmed up that disappated and gave way to molasses and cognac, very rich and strong and similar to standard bourbon county. Low carbonation, thick syrupy mouthfeel, finish that is completely clean. Strong molasses, rich coffee, brown sugar, grade B maple syrup, and bourbon all in the flavor. Very similar to standard bourbon county but a slight bit more bitter overall and maple flavor, surprisingly not a ton of coffee flavor.
Bottle. Black beer with a light tan head. Big coffee aroma with rich malt. Caramel and toffee flavor with coffee. Medium-plus bodied. Coffee and caramel linger with toffee and light chocolate.

Oh this was nice. Tried it a tasting, so I got to balance it against Parabola, Moloko, and Very Mad Cow. This one felt like the statesman of the group. Smooth and professional. While I still rate the standard BC Stout higher, this was still outstanding, and I would go out if my way to score one if I could find one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Hello bourbon coffee elixir. Pours a thick black with a small tan head. Huge bourbon and coffee nose. Coffee in the middle followed by a medium amount of bourbon taking over. So smooth, thick, enjoyed by everyone I shared it with. A little burn in the throat but I like it. Coffee, chocolate, bourbon, how could that be bad?

Tap at GABF 2013. Poured a deep mahogany with a frothy tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt with creamy caramel with a hint of coconut. The flavour is strong bitter with a rich creamy roasted malt toffee caramel coffee palate. Super smooth. Really enjoyed this.

Sample at GABF 2013. Pours black with a big beige head. Aroma of big malt, roast, coffee, caramel and milk chocolate, Put together the flavour is like an amazing dessert or chocolate. Heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Location/Date:2012 Bottle on 10/3/2013 split with Dave, Ben and Jordan..
Appearance: Pours a black opaque.
Aroma: Aroma of roast, coffee.
Taste: Roast, chocolate, coffee
Palate:Medium body, slick, lingering aftertaste.
Summary: As always, really enjoyable. I liked the coffee aspect. Tasty.

2012 Bomber, thanks Bry! Succulent black oily pour with minimal tan head. Holy schnikes! what an aroma, chocolate, ash, oak, lots of bourbon and coffee!! fuck me...its like cake in a cup, super rich, but for a beer thats only a year old its smooth as hell. Coffee is there but doesnt dominate just sort sneaks in towards the back as it trickles down your throat, tons of bourbon in the front, sweet but not cloying...Cannonball!

Pours black, minimal tan head.

Smell is huge ashy roast.

Taste is smooth coffee and vanilla. Rich and creamy.

Fuller bodied.

Tastes way better than the smell. Ok.

2012 bottle, thanks to Kevin L. Huge roasty, coffee, chile nose. Pours cola with thin tan head. Taste: reasonably (not overly) sweet, caramel at end, long sweet finish -- coffee is really well-integrated; sweet with nice roasty finish. Slick, full body, rich. Best of the day so far. Love this.
Bomber to snifter. Sweet boozy and bourbon aroma. Dark but not thick and oily. Nice bitterness from the coffee balances the bourbon sweetness.

2012 vintage - 22 oz. bottle. Pours black with a moderate brown head. Very pleasant aroma of rich coffee, dark chocolate, bourbon, oak, vanilla, brown sugar, along with some very definite alcohol vapors. The flavor is wonderful with roasted malt, rich coffee, dark chocolate, bourbon, oak, vanilla, and brown sugar. Full bodied with a silky mouthfeel. Some definite alcohol heat at the finish as well. Very, very enjoyable!

Bottle shared with Timfoolery. Full bodied, full flavored beer. Right up my alley. SMG and I could definitely taste the coffee. Gotta get another one of these.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22oz. bottle, 2012 vintage. Aroma of espresso, dark chocolate, dark brown sugar, toffee, old wood, earthiness, bourbon, vanilla, black cherry and definite alcohol. Utterly black in color, head is very fine and slight. Flavor profile is strongly roasty, with plenty of dark sweetness, roasty coffee, espresso, dark chocolate, vanilla, oak, bourbon and alcohol, overall incredibly flavorful, toasty, warming and rich. Slick, hot mouthfeel, body is massively full. Very nice.

Bottle from funkyaudio. Aroma of sweet bourbon and coffee. Flavor is definitely the same with strong, sweet coffee, bourbon, and chocolate. Good carbonation, and the palate as a whole was very enjoyable. Excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 Bottle from Timfoolery, aroma is booze and syrup, flavor is sweet coffee. Slight hop finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great. Has the regular version. The coffee is nice. Had this at the Beer Geeks of Northwest Arkansas thanks to Ryan.

This pours pitch black color with a slight brown head. The aroma is a mixture of coffee, bourbon, and sweet caramel malt. There are so many complex flavors that your taste buds are overwhelmed by the taste. What else can I say other than it is some sweet, coffee stout, goodness.

Bottle of the 2012. Pretty solid black with virtually no head. Aroma is big on the coffee, with notes of vanilla, chocolate, and a hint of bourbon. Oily mouthfeel, full bodied, sweet on the palate with some roasty nuttiness on the finish. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, fig, prunes, very subtle hints of bourbon & oak. So tasty.

Bottle share. 2012 bomber. DEEP brown, almost black. Aroma is heavy coffee, vanilla, wood. Taste is massive vanilla, chocolate, super woody, bourbon. Heavy coffee comes in aftertaste, and pound your mouth dry.

Bottle 2012. Pours a black with little to no head. The nose is coffee, vanilla and cocoa power. The flavor is cocoa powder coffee and finishes with a hot, booze bourbon flavor. Over all very balanced but defiantly could age for even more smooth complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bomber thanks Mark. This stuff is all kinds of good. Bourbon coffee chocolate aroma. Flavor is chocolate bourbon coffee in the after taste. Nice smooth oily texture. Really really enjoyed this one.

Tap @ GTMW 13 - with Kenyan coffee.
Pour is classic "Bourbon County" - black with a reddish hue, and almost no head. 
Aroma is also classic BCS, but with (obviously) a whole lot more coffee/roasted coffee beans/delicious espresso. What ever great coffee is, its in this beer.. 
The taste is slightly sweet at first, but is followed by a nice roasted bitterness. 
Semi-full bodied, with a somewhat semi-flat fizzyness (makes sense?) - lol.

66 cl bottle @ BBF VIII. Batch #0133 , bottled 12.11.12. Thanks tiong!
Aroma has lots of mocha, some jalopeno and hints of licorice. Flavour has lots of mocha, some jalopeno, peppery spices, salty licorice and hints of soy sauce. Also some bourbon notes (vanilla, oaky notes) at the end of the glass. A bit too salty but rather nice anyway.

65 cl bottle @ PBF 2013. 2012 vintage. Bottle No. 0113. Bottled on 11/12/12.
Pours dark brown color with a small beige head. Aroma of coffee, dark ripe fruits, some roasted malts, caramel and licorice notes. Flavor of roasted malts, caramel, espresso, vanilla and faint bourbon notes. Sticky sweet sugary palate. Quite nicely balanced and altogether excellent coffee brew.
5316

650 ml bottle @ PBF 2013. Vintage 2012.
Pours a pitch black colour with a creamy beige head. Aroma is very rich with roasted malts, mudcake, dark chocolate, espresso, molasses and licorice. Rich flavour of roasted malts, rich coffee, wood, mudcake, licorice, sweet English toffee and some green apples. Full bodied, thick and dry mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Excellent balance and a unique beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ VIII. Black colour, small brown head. Aroma is strong coffee some mild liquorice, alcohol and some slight salted liquorice. Flavour is liquorice, some salted liquorice, alcohol and some ashtray as well.

660ml bottle @ PBF 2013 from a trade with Hugonaut13. Thanks!
2012 vintage, bottled 11/12/12 0113 - Pours pitch black with a smooth light brown head. Aroma of sweet syrup, wood, oak, roastiness, loads of coffee, vanilla, bourbon and dark chocolate. Taste is smooth, roasty, vinous, complex and bourbony with loads of coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, wood, oak and syrup. Finish has notes of coffee, bourbon, dark chocolate, coffee, wood and oaky notes. Excellently balanced, complex and massively good beer. Awesome stuff.

Bottle.
Rich coffee, fresh, not burnt nor roasted, smell of freshly brewed. 
Warming alcohol, roasted malts linger, with a clean h2o and coffee feel throughout. Slight sugary overload on the tip of tongue before crashing into viscous bliss.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2014  2010 bottle. Black pour, small head, light carbonation. Bourbon and coffee fighting for attention in the aroma. Taste of fresh roasted coffee which is holding up surprisingly well., bourbon, Dark chocolate, toffee. Alcohol is there but barely noticable. Thick full body with lower carb. Glad i was able to get in on this one. Thanks Dany! 

*NOTE*  Had a 2013 during the superbowl.  Far more espresso on this while drinking fresh.  Score revised upward.

Black with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla and cocoa powder. Sweet and full bodied BCS flavour with fresh ground coffee beans on top of that. Doesnt have quite as inviting an aroma, but the flavour is out of this world

Bottle shared with friends, poured into a tulip. Thanks Steve. Pours black with a small beige head. Nose is ridiculous oak, vanilla, roast, very slight coffee. Flavor is vanilla, chocolate, wood, faint coffee. Great smooth full mouthfeel. Very nearly as good as Rare; compared back-to-back with 09 BA Speedway, and this one won.

Bottle of 2011 Anjilanaka, pours a dark brown black with a small tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, light molasses, and mellow coffee Taste similar to aroma a nice sweetness with chocolate and coffee, coffee is still holding up really well super well balanced and drinkable. Glad I ran into this one.

At a Goose Island special event in Denver where there was a tap takeover and the reps were pouring special bottles.
This was on tap and poured black with brown head and lace.
Aroma of coffee and dark malts.
Flavors of espresso, powder sugar, bourbon, dark chocolate, and roasted malts. Overall big, bold, strong with chocolate, coffee, and sweet malts.

This is a big boozy beer. Much more bourbon than coffee. The notes from the java are really buried underneath and it is more almost pre-roasted bean as opposed to brewed coffee notes. A load of caramel follows the bourbon.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2014 2014 Bottle P: Completely black with just a lacing for a head. S: Intense bourbon, chocolate, coffee, molasses, light vanilla, hazelnut and a bit of a dark roast in the back. T: A mixture of bourbon and coffee. Very mellow beer, nothing is to intense. Thick layers of chocolate are laid out, light molasses, oak and just a bit of a warm sensation in the back. M: Lighter then regular bcbs but still thick and chewy. O: Very well done beer, much better young then aged.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2014 5 oz pour from June tasting at Dougs. 2012 bottle. Aroma doesnt seem have much coffee. Mustve faded off. Aromas are bourbon, medium roast, oak and vanilla. Taste has a nice sweet/bitter balance. Some roast and soy sauce to go with fairly big bourbon taste. Very smooth, boozy finish. Very similar to regular BCBS for me.  Re-rate 2/20/14 with Nov 2013 bottle.  Thanks jckp64!  Much different than I remember.  Pours black with almost no head.  Aroma is ridiculously good.  Roasted (almost burnt) coffee, vanilla, oak, chocolate fudge, caramel, toffee, and a hint of raisins.  Taste is not up there with the aroma but still very good.  Lots of burnt coffee, caramel, and vanilla up front with a nice sweetness.  Turns bitter later with some raisins, tobacco, and boozy oak.  Mouthfeel is silky smooth but also pretty flat.  Great beer but I wish there was some more carbonation.  I would love to have this on tap some day.  Re-rate 12/12/14 - Fresh 2014 pour on tap at The Oak.  This version seems absolutely packed with medium roasted coffee.  Barely get any chocolate but its still delicious.  Hint of bourbon heat in the finish.  Great beer.
Pours dark n thick. This beer is just perfection. My all time #1............

22oz bottle, 2012 edition, Im not sure this benefits at all from the dose of coffee, I found myself reflecting back to some of the better bourbon county stouts and thinking how there wasnt a huge difference, some light acidity from the coffee, lots of vanilla but still just a good to great beer

Bomber received in trade! Thank you lionsandbeer. One of the simplest ratings Ive written since this very much is exactly what it says it is. Its Bourbon County Stout with high quality dark roast coffee in both smell and taste. A great coffee/bourbon/vanilla stout but Id say the regular kind is just a hint better.
Bottle. Pours black with a small brown head. Aroma is oak, coffee, vanilla notes, smoke, roasted malt. Flavor is bitter coffee, oak, charcoal, roast. Oily mouthfull, really delicious.

2012. Bottle # 0329. Thanks to Sean9689. Pours black with a small thick creamy beige head and lacings. Nose is lovely. Oak, vanilla, roast, coffee and liquorice. Flavor is liquorice, roast, vanilla , wood and coffee. Silky smooth and vinous. The base beer is badass and this is just as incredible. Yeah!

Pour is black with a brown head and good legs. Smell of bourbon, cocoa, oak, vanilla, coffee, raisins, and brown sugar. Taste is coffee, chocolate, oak, whiskey and a hint of vanilla. Nice syrupy mouthfeel. Great beer.

Black thick liquid with a mocha head that disappears quickly. Aroma: rich dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla and loads of coffee very nice. Taste: sweet, coffeee, bourbon, chocolate, oak, vanilla, booze. Very rich. Awesome brew!

On tap at the 1st annual Asheville Rare & Wild Beer Tasting 2013, this pours opaque black into the glass, with a nicely diminishing tan head. The roasted coffee nose is exquisite. Flavors of wet tobacco leaf, lots of roasted coffee, a hint of nuttiness, tons of sweet malt and light chocolates finish with a roasted coffee-and-cream essence. The ABV provides a nice warmth without the alcoholic sting. The full body is complemented by an extremely smooth mouthfeel. Another winner by Goose Island!

Sampled at The Asheville Rare & Wild Tasting. Black, as you might expect. Nice brown head. Smells one would imagine a drunkards breakfast would smell - coffee and whiskey. Lots of coffee and whiskey in the flavor, too plus a good deal of chocolate and vanilla. Nice rich, smooth palate. I liked it...

Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Bourbon up front, with some almost chocolate like sweetness. A second wave brings roasted malts, fresh roasted coffee, and some oaky woody notes. Finishes with bourbon, vanilla sweetness, and faint hints of dark fruits. Relatively low hop profile. Really good, definitely better than I expected. Super easy to drink too.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2013 Bomber..from 2SP Newark..surprised by recent price drop on this..20 bucks..wow..couldnt pass up chance to try this..served a bit cold but warmed up nicely..jet black pour..very little head as expected..aroma is like an amazing coffee infused bourbon treat with a shot of vanilla creaminess..quite memorable nose..mouthfeel is quite complex and full bodied with a richness..dominated by decadent coffee..chocolate..vanilla imperial stout goodness..just the right proportion of everything in play here..the bourbon and coffee play off each other nicely and I thoroughly enjoyed this and found it more complex and better than the regular BCS...awesome beer..upped the score after comparing this with draft kbs..this edged it out..deserving of higher score..

Bomber (dated 11/12/2012). Perfect ebony color with a thin mocha head that doesnt dissipate and uniform lacing.  Awesome layered aroma of fresh-roasted coffee, bourbon sweetness, oak, and a slight vinegar, meaty smokiness like a steak marinated in Worcester sauce on the grill. Huge espresso kick on the first sip before the bourbon and decadent chocolate join the party. A touch of the smokiness also comes through in the taste along with a bit of tangy, woody, spiciness; still a bit hot. Silky texture with a long, heavy chocolate finish. Nice, but not quite as good as the regular BCS.
2012 bottle from Chevy Chase in DC.  Enjoyed this a lot.  Tried a 2011 version later, and wasnt as good.  Very smooth and well blended flavors.

Bottle at craft ale house. Pours pitch black with no head to speak of. The aroma is not pungent but has light coffee and chocolate. The taste has a nice milk chocolate mix with coffee grind and bourbon.
Thanks Mike W. for the taste.  Aroma is great and rich coffee, dark roasted malts, molasses, figs and bourbon goodness. Very easy to drink given the high ABV. Great beer.

Location: Draft at Ginger Man, 4/12/13


Aroma: It has a fairly bourbon nose with some coffee/roast malts as well

Appearance: It pours a dark brown color with a small head and some light lace

Flavor: The taste is similar to the nose, medium sweet, and without much bitterness

Palate: It has a smooth and creamy full bodied feel, with some burn, but it is still fairly easy to drink

Overall Impression: 
Very good stuff.  This one hit my expectations pretty much right on.  I was glad to stumble upon it on draft at Ginger Man.

Bottle @ ZeeBra Extreme Beer Festival 2013. Pitch black pour, tan head. Aroma is creamy, leather, bourbon, smooth chocolate, coffee and caramel. Flavor is extremely smooth, coffee, vanilla, loads of bourbon, creamy. Very smooth and balanced. Amazing brew.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2014 Bottle 2012 #2253 thanks Artmcd8. Poured black minimal light brown head. Slightly spicy aroma. Tingly coffee choco taste. Updated at Midwest Brewers Fest.

Bottle 2013 1717. Poured black brown with tan head. Aroma of nice bourbon vanilla with licorice pretzel coffee. Light carb thick bod. Bittersweet choc bourbon taste, lingering smoke char.

Pours a deep black with no head. Aroma of bourbon and coffee. Slightly sweet with an alcohol burn. Very tasty stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ ZeeBra. Aroma is big roast, huge liquorice, mad coffee, vanilla, ash and more. Flavour is intense vanilla infused with coffee, roast, mocca liquorice and more. LRAB.

ZEBF 13
no idea of the vintage . Im guessing 2012

pours black, no foam. 
smell is sharp, intence, coffee, but in a bad way .. 
soft carbo, all coffee in the taste, together with the bourbon. 
bitter aftertaste , more towards bourbon in the end.
Poured a dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of roast malt, a little coffee and dark chocolate, dark alcohol soaked fruit. Full body, flavour as the aroma. Could have been a bit more coffee-ish.
Sweet bourbon, raisins, only a bit of coffee. Amazingly rich. Sharp start, but worth the complexity. Medicinal hops, alcohol burn. Oily body. Big, powerful brew for the bourbon lover. (ZeeBra)

Bottle. Pitch black with a small brown head.  Aroma is bourbon first and foremost, coffee, caramel, just a little green pepper.  Taste is very sweet, almost no bitterness, a little alcohol.  Finish is sweet, alcoholic with a little roast/coffee.  Full bodied, soft carbonation.  Its BCS with a little coffee, next year Ill make sure to try a fresh bottle to see if theres more of a coffee presence.

22 oz bottle. Bottled on 11/12/ 12. Nose is really nice. Earthy coffee, chocolate, brown sugar and oak. Flavor is really delightful. Chocolate up front with oak, bourbon with some deep roasted notes. Secondary notes of vanilla, high end coffee bean. ABV is totally mellow. God this is great!! Awesome is every regards.

Draft. Pours jet black with a little chocolate colored head. Nose is syrupy bourbon, chocolate and just a hint of coffee. Taste is very similar. Kinda wish the coffee was a bit more prominent as this is pretty similar to the base beer. Still very awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 ounce bottle from 2011, divvied up among 6. Aroma is light roast coffee beans, fireplace wood pile, bourbon and caramel. Appearance is black, thin residue of brown lacing on the glass, a layer of foam film on the surface that helps deliver that coffee and chocolate aroma. Taste has all the same aspects as the aroma, plus a mild rye and vanilla component.  Palate is on the thin side of thick bodied, noticeable abv, low carbonation. No surprises here, this one is a solid performance of the traditional coffee imperial stout style. Id like to see how this differs from the other years different coffee blends.
Dark black.  No head.  Dark.  Smells like bourbon.  Tastes like bourbon.  Thanks Tony bretz.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2014 UPDATE: 2013 bottle rated 1-3-14. Proper temp into snifter. Pours black. Small fizzy brown head, mostly dissipating. Aroma is loaded with coffee. Rich, dark coffee grounds, espresso, chocolate, sugar, touch of vanilla and wood, bourbon more in the background, not at all boozey. Coffee is front and center and takes over most of the aroma. Full body. Silky, soft and creamy. Flavor starts full of bittersweet coffee (more sweet than bitter) then bursts into bourbon barrel character. Finishes moderate roast sweet with a healthy dose of bourbon. Pleasant alcohol warmth that almost gets too hot but subsides just in time. Killer coffee beer. 

2012 draft(i think) rated 4-19-13. To sum up: Did not enjoy this as much as the original. There seemed to be much more hot alcohol in the flavor, aroma, and palate and it really took over the show for me. Coffee character was almost undetectable until only a small amount remained in the glass (volume - not a temp issue). Still a fantastic beer without a doubt, but it has a tall standard to measure up to. (scored: 9.4.9.4.20 =4.6)

Bottle at Easter brunch. Pours black, thick and syrupy with a small tan head. Aroma is of bourbon, oak, vanilla, medium roast coffee, and lots of alcohol. Taste is sweet boozy syrupy chocolate, roasts coffee, bourbon, oak, vanilla, lingering hop bitterness on the end interwoven with the hot alcohol. A bit too hot right now, should have let it sit a little longer.

Bottle, from trade with matboz. Pours a pitch black body with a small off-white head. Aroma is deep soy-like coffee tones, ashes, coal, tar and leather with sweet malts in the back. Taste is strong coffee tones, dark malts, booze, sweet toffee, vanilla and hints of leather and brown sugar. Smooth, thick palate with semi-soft carbonation. Nice coffee stout, but not at all as epic as advertised.

Bottle, from Van Loans, real good aroma,.sweet. coffee, chocolate, marsh mellow. Banana.  Dark brown color, small head, little to no lace. Sweet bitter flavor. Medium bodied, creamy oily mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. Darn tasty, love the coffee. Nice sweet roasty aroma and flavor.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: This beer is a masterpiece. Worth the hype and praise. An absolute contender for the BA #1 beer in the world.

Samples from a 2010 bottle and a 2012 bottle, side by side, at Cams BCBS tasting. Huge coffee nose, some bitter. A lot of coffee still there in the 10, too. Dark brown / red clear-still color. Thin off-white head, couple dots of lace. Light, soft carbonation. Good chewy texture. Dry finish. Bitter taste. Light alcohol burn in the finish on the 12. More dark fruit flavors evident in the 10. Burn is barely mellowed in the older vintage, if it all. Some raisin. Very enjoyable, tasty stuff. I prefer the 12. Bigger coffee note helps to mask the general coffee bite. Good long, coffee aftertaste.

22oz bottle from JMRSN. Reviewed from notes. 

A: Fizzing pour yields an obsidian black body with a geyser turbulating the middle of the surface. Theres an acceptable ring of dark mocha colored head, and legs leave a brown stain on the glass.

N: Loads of vanilla and caramel. Bourbon and wood are pronounced. Chocolate cake with a touch of soy sauce. Theres a touch of espresso. Alcohol soaked raisins.

T: Raisins, vanilla, chocolate, and a coffee acidity. Some roast, but this is mostly sweet with a little spice like that of rye whiskey. Some salt.

M: Coating and yet some wateriness at the end. Lots of alcohol.

O: I expected more coffee out of this vintage. This also has a quality I dont recall from the 2010 vintage, and as such, its good, but its not the best of the lineup. Still worthy.
bourbon county stout with coffee flavors.... basically tastes as advertised.

2012 bottle.  Very similar to the BCBS rating I have.  Phenomenal nose of fresh coffee, bourbon, chocolate, and some roast.  Taste follows the nose with some vanilla sweetness as well.  Outside of Vanilla (and I guess Rare) this is my favorite variant.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle shared by mr. hoppypocket, thanks! pours inky black with a small dark crema, some retention. nose is mostly filled by bourbon, toasted and burnt coconut, booze and vanilla. some coffee seeps through at first sip for a bittering short to medium long coffee finish. dark roasted malts, some burnt notes, woodiness, smoke. cloying dark molasses. soft carbonation, medium to full body, sticky. no subtlety here.

Bottle - thanks Jeremiah! Pours opaque black with a small brown creamy head that dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is very rich with notes of coffee, bourbon, dark roasted malts, and molasses. Flavor is the same, medium sweet, lightly bitter, some chocolate. Definitely bourbon BA, but it is not overpowering. Full body, creamy mouthfeel. Very very nice. A light warming finish is the only way that the 13% ABV makes its presence felt.

Thanks bytemesis for sharing! Black color, decent head for a stout, nice and sticky on the glass. Rich aroma, molasses, figs. Flavor is also rich up front, chocolate, molasses or syrup, nuts, and coffee roast rising in the finish. Some alcohol from the bourbon finish. Excellent brew.

Bottle at home. Pour is deep, viscous black with a frothy brown head and good legs on the side of my snifter. Big bourbon, cocoa, oak, a hint of vanilla, green coffee, light soy, raisins, toffee, and brown sugar in the aroma. Taste is big coffee - but more like fresh green coffee, as I am picking up light pepper notes - chocolate, oak, whiskey, espresso - a hint of vanilla through the sweet middle - caramel, figs, and candi sugar with a light alcoholic burn on the finish. Slick/syrupy mouthfeel with medium-to-soft carbonation. The alcohol in this one isnt overpowering and I dig the coffee variation, more than the original, although, I would have liked to see a more restrained use of coffee, as it is a little too much on the green side. Still an awesome stout!

Bottle 22oz.
Pours blac with low beige head. Aroma is of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, alcohol. Taste is of roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, wood, alcohol, bourbon. Pretty complex. Palate: Oily. Full bodied. Overall: Quite impressive, a very good and serious beer.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2013 Bottle (22 oz) 2012. Shared by Hoppypocket, thanks! Black with almost no head and a slight beige lacing. Aroma is intense with coffee, roasted malt, caramel, vanilla and coconut. Taste is moderately sweet with strong notes of coffee, caramel, roasted malt and a slight bitter finish. Smooth, oily and slight dry (from the coffee bitterness) mouthfeel. Heavy body. Warming alcohol. Rich and complex beer with a good balance between coffee and bourbon. Nice RIS.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2014 Bottle generously shared by David, thanks a lot man! Pours deep black with virtually no head unless you count that brown ring. Aroma is a full on bourbon attack backed by a coffee rush. Intense and challenging. Taste is medium sweet with flavors of coffee and again BOURBON. A really nice sipper, it reminds me of a more intense BA Pêché Mortel really. Id drink that on a regular basis!

Pours ink black with minimal head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, and a hint of roast with some vanilla. Taste is deep coffee, bourbon, and molassis. The coffee is exceptionally well blended. Drinks beautifully. Great Beer and 100% worth its hype.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2013 Pours a pitch black with minimal head. Aromas of Roasted coffee, cocoa, vanilla, bourbon. Taste is full of coffee, bitter chocolate, vanilla, lots of bourbon, roasted malts and a faint green peppers. Full mouthfeel and low carbonation. A slow sipper. A great one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2013 Pours black, very thin swirly beige head. Nose is bourbon, wood, roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee. Taste is bourbon, wood, dark chocolate, espresso. Coffee is much more subtle than I expected. Full mouthfeel.

2012 vintage thanks to HopsHopenstein. Dark black color, no head whatsoever in either glass. Wonderful coffee smell off the bat with only the slightest note of bourbon. Flavor was good coffee, slight hint of chocolate and vanilla. This was a good beer but anything more than a couple ounces and its just a chore to finish. There is a huge astringency from the alcohol that comes over your tongue in a wave after each sip. Its just too damn strong. If this was around 9% it would probably be amazing.

Serving type: bottle

03-07-2013 01:58:38
